Reviews.Title: “I would of rather sleep in the car...”
Reviews.Author: sandman309
Reviews.Content: Air conditioning was not working. Offered me a fan, not a room with working air. The uninspected wake up calls at 2:00am, 2:15am and 2:30am was a nice touch. Thank you for not letting me sleep threw the night. I really liked charges on my credit card for the mini bar I never used. Upon check out I had to wait in a long line for the other customers that were complaining about their stay...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel dosn't get back to you”
Reviews.Author: AlanLee
Reviews.Content: I have tried to contact the Front Desk but they haven't even replied to my queries. I have even emailed the Manager directly, via the contact details left by her on this site. I'm not to sure what's going on here, and feel ignored. I happy to leave another review after my visit and hopefully it will be more positive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: WimVds
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by friends and it was absolutely spot on : the location is great, one block at away from the Magnificent Mile, just off the John Hancock Tower and within walking distance of all major shopping. The room was large and clean, with a small kitchenette and a very clean, but relatively small bathroom. Just the thing you need for a (long) weekend in Chicago !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and helpful”
Reviews.Author: lucyanne1
Reviews.Content: The property was lovely. I was in room 912 and it was delightfully decorated. Oddly there was a slight vibration noise behind the wall mirror which was next to the air conditioning unit. The bathroom was beautiful with a rainforest shower head...loved it! A magnifying mirror would have been theory I would have liked to have in my bathroom. A most comfortable bed was there and I slept soundly. Mhighlynrecommend.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - great location!”
Reviews.Author: Niamhie001
Reviews.Content: Just back from a break in Chicago and I have to say I have only good things to say about this hotel. The location is excellent, just off Magnificant Mile, 2 minutes walk to John Hancock Tower and a little further to the Water Tower for excellent shopping. We had a suite between 3 and the room was a perfect size and really comfortable and luxurious. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. Only thing is that the bar is quite small in the hotel, however, there are lots of choices around for a few scoops so this did not really detract from the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to book through Living Social deal, no rooms available”
Reviews.Author: hesterm
Reviews.Content: Similar to other reviews, no rooms available when purchased under the Living Social deal. Only a few during a whole month, during the week. I don't think so. Seems the deal showed the hotel's true colors. Waiting to hear if Living Social will refund my money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite and Location”
Reviews.Author: Patricia J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location near Michigan Avenue shopping and dining. The suite was wonderful! It was large and the minibar had a great selection. Also loved the rain shower shower head and large shower area. The service was great, too! I would strongly recommend the Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, living social”
Reviews.Author: boltonbee
Reviews.Content: Charming boutique hotel in a great neighborhood! Pillows, bed, rain shower head, and robes were better than I've had at more expensive hotels. View was meh and suite layout was odd but overall it was a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Read the Terrible Reviews”
Reviews.Author: goyaDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: Was in the process of booking this hotel for a week in December and was encouraged by Tripadvisors recommendations. However, having read these terrible reviews I wonder how Tripadvisor can stand behind this recommendation when so many people have had such a horrible experience. The management of the Rafaello would be better off if they did not respond with the same useless rigmarole, how ridiculous to invite people to come back to what one reviewer called "a hole" and give them a second chance. Do they not realise that for many people their holiday is a hard-earned and long anticipated event to which they travel great distances and arrived tired and hopeful in their selection. I know from personal experience the heartbreak involved in taking your family to a bad hotel and I wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy. Tripadvisor, PLEASE TAKE NOTE

Reviews.Title: “Living social deal”
Reviews.Author: kbo3
Reviews.Content: By boyfriend and I stayed here after spending a night on the town with friends. The rooms were darling, but good in size for a boutique hotel. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfy. We ordered pizza from a local place, the menu was provided by the front desk, and it was delivered. We had a living social deal and were really pleased with this hotel. Great location!! The only down fall is the parking, they make it seem as tho self parking is easily accessibly and that a discount will be provided at check out. We tried to receive this discount and were told we went to the wrong lot. Parking is poorly labeled. Over all we would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Room!”
Reviews.Author: LiveNowLaura
Reviews.Content: Quaint hotel with an ideal location! We walked everywhere. I love being in walking distance to the water, shopping, great restaurants and sites. The hotel is hip and as a bonus a block way from the crazy traffic and noise. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: h0lym0ly
Reviews.Content: I joined my husband on his business retreat for 2 days in Chicago and the whole group was staying at this hotel. We had a suite on the 7th floor and it was very spacious and quiet and the bed was comfy.The bathroom was huge with a big glass shower (no tub) and granite counters. One thing I missed was a make-up mirror. We never had to wait for an elevator (as in previous reviews) and I found the fitness centre to be adequate. I really enjoyed the location of the hotel. I was able to come and go so easily and shop along the Magnificent Mile and come back whenever I needed to. There were lots of restaurants and coffee shops nearby and I could bring food back to my room and relax. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a very small bar in the lobby and our group was able to use it for a kick-off gathering before going out to dinner the first night. Previously we have always stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Chicago and I would say that this hotel is of course not as luxurious but it is very good value at a great price. And I appreciated that I could come and go with ease and be able to shop and sightsee so closeby. It was a great choice for our business group.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, hot, hot!”
Reviews.Author: Jen1967
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Raffaello on many occasions due to its terrific location and small size charm. The staff is very nice, the rooms are spacious, and you can't beat the proximity to the Gold Coast neighborhood. Unfortunately, on several occasions we have experienced rooms that just won't cool off enough. The bed and linens are like sleeping in a cloud.....until you wake up drenched in perspiration. Not all of our rooms have had this issue, but it has happened enough that we are considering a change of locations for a week long stay.....in July.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location!”
Reviews.Author: GBCheesehead
Reviews.Content: Very nice find in downtown Chicago. Great location, great rooms & reasonable! I would definitely stay here again & recommend to friends. Watertower Place/Michigan Ave is just one block away. Close to the lakeshore, too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: I just spent 2 nights at the Raffaello in a suite and found the accommodations to be exactly what I was expecting, a satisfactory hotel near the magnificent mile at a reasonable price. Managed to get a winter special rate of 149.00+ tax and felt at that price this hotel offered good value. Positives: -Location-about a block off the magnificent mile, next to the John Hancock tower -Value-fair price for a decent room near the magnificent mile -Room-Comfortable-definitely in need of a refresh, but again the price was right -Refrigerator- I am always surprised when a hotel room does not have a refrigerator, but some do not. The Raffaello has them, at least in the suites and they had left some space for my own personal beverages as opposed to cramming it with items. Bonus, there was also a microwave, which is a rarity. -Mini Bar prices-I tend to stay away from the mini-bar and there is a Walgreens a block or 2 south on Michigan Ave; however, compared to most hotels I have stayed at the mini bar prices were reasonable. That being said, I purchased only 1 coke because I needed a caffeine kick and neglected to get any at the Walgreens Negatives: -Elevators-The hotel did not seem to be very full, so this was not a huge issue, but if it were, the elevators would definitely be a problem. The max accommodation is 4 people per elevator-2 people with bags and there are only 2 elevators. There were a few instances where we had to wait as the elevator was full. This was a minor annoyance as there seemed to be few guests. -Breakfast- Which I did not order. I have stayed at many hotels and the price for breakfast seemed totally unreasonable at 25.00 per person for what read on the menu as a pretty plain beverage, egg, bread and meat. -Bathroom-Pretty small and personally I am not a fan of the rain shower heads. As mentioned in other reviews the lack of a shower door leads to some pretty wet floors. I was happy that their was a small seating area just outside the bathroom for my wife to get ready at. All in all I was happy with the room for the price paid, at full price I may have been a little disappointed. If the room were a a little fresher, I probably would give this hotel 4 stars, but the seating, carpeting and furniture were definitely showing their age

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly - parking was very convenient and rooms were nice and clean. Room layout a little small (beds are only doubles). Otherwise very nice. great location. Area recommendations I like Magnificent Mile and Streeterville but sometime choose Lincoln Park or River North It depends on what we plan to do.

Reviews.Title: “charming and close to so much!”
Reviews.Author: snorkel-luvin
Reviews.Content: The Rafaello is on a quiet, lovely street just between Lake Shore Drive (lakefront) and The Hancock Tower and water tower, close to great skyline views, shopping, many restaurants, pubs and shopping, Oak Street beach and Navy Pier. The concierge were very accomodating. It has recently been updated, and all is slick. Small, nice bar off the lobby where we met friends. The room has some nice ammenities--all rooms have a mini-fridge (just remove the stuff in it and don't drink them or $$$$), microwave, wine glasses and corkscrew, Keurig coffee maker and even a shoe shine machine! Rooms with better views were a bit smaller, and the slightly larger rooms had scenic views of the dumpsters below (good for a few laughs, anyway). A cozy, great hotel! We had a Living Social coupon, so got a really good deal. If I paid premium dollar in the summer, I might look for somewhere cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: corjb
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Raffaello. The service was excellent, and the location was great (a short walk to the Brown and Red lines).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: gidget&rocky
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we werre greeted by some of the most friendly doorman we have come across. A smile and great scense of humor. (Even though the weather in Chi-town was horrible during our stay.) This hotel is in prime location to the Magnificant Mile and the Water Tower Place, good distance to some fantastic restaurants. Rush Street is so very close and so is the lake. This would be the perfcet location for a summer visit. The room was very nice. The only this I regret is paying additional for a higher room. If I stayed there again I would not do so. Reason being, is is located right next to the John Handcock Tower and that is all you see, not the beautiful Chicago Skyline. However, being higher up gave us more quiet than the Chicago traffic. So, it was a wash I guess. The bed and all decor was beautiful and comfortable. I think next time I booked I would go for the suite. A very wonderful experiance. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley9962
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel in Chicago. Excellent location, beautifully appointed rooms, excellent amenities (I just wish they'd add a microwave!) and lovely staff. I've stayed here on shopping trips, museum trips and even when I took the bar exam (I needed someplace I was comfortable to study and rest between exams). We stayed here during reconstruction and post-construction and simply cannot recommend it enough. Unless, of course, it is full on a weekend I want to go into the city. Then the place is horrible - don't book it so I can get a room!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Chic & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: SandCLarson610
Reviews.Content: The Rafaello is a "tailored" hotel, like the perfect tuck of a hospital corner. Everything is neat, as are the staff. They are also extremely nice and accomodating. We have not one complaint. My husband and I were pleasantly surprised to see plush robes hanging in the bedroom closet. This hotel even has good-tasting brewed coffee in the lobby bar. That is often not the case with complimentary coffee. Warm and welcoming staff; cozy rooms; yummy coffee all equals a happy (and future) patron.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Bfinearth
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Interesting rooms. Great small hotel surrounded by massive, less personal hotels. Though expensive, had a wonderful meal at Pelago. Got a very good deal on Jetsetter.com for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Manophouse
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended the Raffaello; we tried it and loved it and it is now our go-to hotel when we visit Chicago. The hotel is ideally situated two blocks off Michigan Avenue. It is beautifully decorated and feels like a European boutique hotel. The rooms are super clean with fabulous linens. The staff is excellent and the hotel is not priced out of reach. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Personal travel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: SportsGal461
Reviews.Content: Stayed during weeknights and found the location outstanding, staff was friendly, room was very clean, modern and I liked the layout. Amenities included a Kcup coffee maker! Great location within a 1/2 block of Water Tower Place and within 2 blocks of 900 North Michigan shoppes. Great location if you are interested in attending musicals at the Broadway Playhouse in Water Tower Place. Will return there soon hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “A very classy hotel, with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: CZGreenlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello during the first week of December 2011 through a living social deal. The hotel itself was very classy and elegantly updated. The lobby was super modern and the rooms were updated but still had some of the original character of the hotel. The bed was a king and was super comfy. The room was very large and we were provided with two robs as well as music playing when we came into the room the first time. The location wasn't too shabby either. Located directly behind the Hancock Tower we were one block from Michigan Ave. for awesome shopping and dining. Having been to Chicago several times, we hadn't yet been up in the Hancock Tower and finally took the chance, being located so close to it. Good tip though: go up to the bar two floors down from the top for drinks and a free elevator ride, rather than paying to go all the way to the top. The view was still phenomenal from that height. There was a restaurant on site of the hotel we didn't use and the staff was very friendly. At times a few of the employees did seem a bit snobby, but overall we had a great experience at the Rafaello.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: This property is in the perfect location for a Chicago getaway. Close to shopping, dining, and the waterfront. Nicely appointed rooms and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Chicago Lodging!”
Reviews.Author: AnnWebsterGrovesMO
Reviews.Content: Loved the doormen. Room was very spacious for $99. Right behind the John Hancock building. Just off MIchigan Avenue, so can take your goodies back to your room rather than lug them around all day. Hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: cdm209
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took advantage of a living social deal and stayed here the night of Christmas. We were in town to visit some friends and this hotel was at a great location and had very friendly front desk staff. Room service closes early, but the rooms were much bigger than expected and like I mentioned before, the location is great. In fact, our view was the Hancock Tower and it was a block away from Michigan Ave. We'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “European Feel”
Reviews.Author: jays911
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel we keep coming back to. It has a smallish, Euro feel, but without the small rooms or snobbishness of some of those types of properties. This is not a hotel for those who like the big hotel experience, or need 24 hour concierge service. Rather, it is for those who like a hotel that is friendly, in a geat location, with large and comfortable rooms, and a personality all its own. There are lots of fancier hotels in Chicago, but in terms of value and friendliness, it is hard to beat the Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Rafaello.....”
Reviews.Author: Los T
Reviews.Content: we visited the hotel for leisure in summer 2011. Mix heatwave with aircon failure and there we are....! We did get a refund for 1/3 nights which is reasonable given the circumstances. We had a room with separate living area which is brilliant when you have a toddler with you. the rooms are styled differently to how I'd choose but I love the hotel, location and of course Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Get a good room or suffer”
Reviews.Author: Jim R
Reviews.Content: If you're unfortunate enough to get a room that ends in 12 (xx12), you're in for a treat: a nice view of the alley where a man will take out garbage every hour (it's loud), excellent acoustics to hear the ice machine, and the smallest room in the hotel! Your one tiny window will be recessed so very little natural light will enter the room (most other rooms have 3 larger windows or more). I'm mostly writing this as a tip -- if you get assigned this room style, ask for a different one.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: indiana1231
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a king suite which was huge. Very cool hotel in a very convenient spot.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Trenea
Reviews.Content: This is the best Hotel I've stayed at in Chicago! Great sized rooms withs a great view of the Hancock Tower. The bathrooms are amazing with a wonderful rainshower shower head to boot. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location for shopping, dining, sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Z01
Reviews.Content: We were a party of two staying in Chicago for a leisure weekend. Our stay was for three nights beginning 12/01/2011. Raffaello Hotel was very conveniently located to transportation, shopping, dining and sightseeing. The staff was polite, prompt, courteous. The room was clean, linens were clean and crisp. The king bed was wonderful, the pillows comfy. We did not eat at the restaurant at this hotel, we did not use room service nor did we drink at the hotel's bar. I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel's location. Minor criticisms: The hotel's two elevators each measure about four foot by four foot. Rather smallish. Also, the shower featured a fixed glass panel.... no sliding shower door and no shower curtain. I would definitely stay at the Raffaello again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Mario C
Reviews.Content: I learned of them through living social but unfortunately my stay which was or business was outside of dates on the offer. Regardless I needed a room in that area and the Westin next door was over 400.00 for the night. I opted to give the Raffaello a shot. It's probably worth mentioning that I am a frequent travel, mostly loyal to Marriott. I opted to book the night t th Raffaello because of the the rate and was really taken by surprise. The staff was extremely helpful, checking in was fast, there was life in the lobby bar, it just felt warm. Then when I got to my room I immediately thought to myself this is my new spot in downtown Chicago. My room was impressive in space and was very comfortable. This 50+ night a year Marriott guy will be snubbing them in favor of the Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Liars”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: Living Social had a $99/night deal. I called the hotel, asked for a room, they said it was available and asked how I'd like to pay. I told them I had the Living Social deal and then the room was suddenly and magically unavailable. The date I wanted was NOT on the blacked-out date list and the fine print only said "subject to availability". The funny part was, they just told me a room was indeed available. Living Social refunded my purchase but I will NEVER STAY HERE because they are liars.

Reviews.Title: “overall very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: I_like_2_travel008
Reviews.Content: Depending what you are looking for, very much depends on whether to stay at this hotel. We recently stayed there but only needed a "base" in Chicago as we only spent time sleeping there and to be honest that is pretty much all they have to offer. The rooms were very good, good size, clean, good condition, comfortable beds etc. The location was also very good - just one short block from Michigan Avenue and very close to all the shops. However, if you want room service the only thing they offer is from their onsite restaurant which is expensive and only available until 10.30pm. They do not offer any decent option for breakfast - you can order only room service which I presume they "bring in" from somewhere else and it is very expensive there is no restaurant offering breakfast onsite. They do have free coffee in the bar area (which is tiny) every morning, but if you like drinking very, very bad tasting coffee its great otherwise I do not advise anyone to try it. Everything you need service wise is done through the front desk which can be very frustrating as the hotel is not small room number wise, there are only ever 1-2 people on the front desk and you have to wait either by being put on hold from your hotel room or by lining up while they are dealing with other guests. If you need anything at night time, forget it, as I think there are only 2 members of staff on the premises one at reception and one at the door, both of which can only give basic help. There are no management onsite at night to actually help solve a problem. The day time reception staff are better and we found them helpful but good luck if you have a problem at night!!! In a time when many hotels offer free internet we found the prices very high and the system a pain in the butt as you have to ask for a new code every single day again from the front desk who are busy otherwise you can not access the net - the lobby offers free wifi but there is no privacy. They supposedly offer a business center that is unmanned and has very, very little to offer - so a waste of time in my opinion. In general the hotel was absolutley fine and good for our needs and we will stay again but do not expect much more than a decent, clean room in a good location at a fair price....

Reviews.Title: “Our new Chicago weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: JTS-Indy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other hotels in the general area, and this was our best experience of them all. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are not overly large, but the furnishings and layout make up for pure square footage. We were on the 17th floor and they were in the middle of renovating the 18th & the "sundeck" - so we forgave the early afternoon crashing & banging. We look forward to staying here in warmer times and taking advantage of the sundeck. The location is great and it's only a 5 blocks away from the red-line "L" station. They will charge you $9 a day for a Wifi connection in your room, but we would still highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot close to everything! Lot of space in deluxe room”
Reviews.Author: familydiversCanada
Reviews.Content: Great value so close to everything. Highly reccomend location for proximicy to all shopping and attractions like Navy Pier. a good walk is to head down Michigan avenue all the way to the art instititute.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value but needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Swissworld_traveller
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent: one block from John Hancock Tower and two blocks from the Magnificent Mile. Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. However if you want to take the metro, you will have to walk a little bit more. Our room was not ready for an early check-in but the staff was very friendly and helpful; we even got an upgrade in a suite. The suite was big, comfortable and clean with two flat-screen tv's, a microwave, a coffee-machine, etc. On the dark side, the furniture was worn, the walls needed to be repainted and the decor needed an upgrade. It is a matter of atmosphere that did not match what you are expecting from a 4* hotel. WiFi is not free. The only way to have breakfast is with room-service.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: RedInTheHead75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary and while the location was great; nothing else was! I'll try to sum it up: our room was the size of a closet, I had to stand on the bed and hold on to the headboard to look into the full length mirror! No food service at that time & since we paid with a debit card, they made an actual withdrawal of over $200.00 just in case we drank/ate from the mini bar! They said they would "refund" us after we checked out and it could take up to 10 days before we would see it! I will never go back & have told others not to go a well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet and chic”
Reviews.Author: travelbee38
Reviews.Content: This was definitely a cute boutique hotel. Our stay was for four days. The service was wonderful and the front desk was always available to help us find local restaurants and places to go. The room we stayed in had two double beds and was on the 14th Floor. It was a typical room but very nicely kept with windows facing the other city buildings. The washroom was my favorite with great mirrors and a nice seating area for you to do hair and makeup. There was a shoe shine buffer in the room and a large LCD TV that worked lovely and could be seen anywhere in the room. Location Location Location- was extremely close to all shopping and right in the heart of downtown Chicago. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Luxury boutique hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: socaltraveller18
Reviews.Content: A wonderful location a block from the Water Tower, closer to the lake. The rate was super, and then we got upgraded. There were obvoius upgrades to the bed and the TVs, view was ok. Decor in general was done well. Staff was pleasant. Don't go for the lobby bar, etc if that's how you spend your hotel stays, but it's Chicago, there's a ton of places to go. One tip on parking, the self park that the hotel recommends is only a block away and if you're not planning on in and out privileges save the extra 3 bucks a night and go directly to the garage. It's 26 per night with no in and out and 29 with in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Raffaello Chicago”
Reviews.Author: GdayNY
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Raffaello twice for business, actually had our meetings at the hotel. The hotel is very nice and location is good, directly behind the Hancock building and just a block from Michigan Ave. Rooms vary in size, one year I had a rather small room and the next I had a large room, if planing to have more than 2 people in the room you should ask in advance for one of their larger rooms. The meeting facilities on the top foor were also very nice, large flat screen monitor for presentations, catering from the hotel restaurant with excellent food and size was good for our group, about 15-17 people. Easy walk to much of downtown Chicago with all the restaurants, shops and sights to see. If you have time go up to the coctail lounge in the Hancock tower, it's free to go up and the view is great (drinks are good too).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: bebeloz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 night during the first week of October. The lobby and elevator are very small but it wasn't that big of a deal. The room is gorgeous and the rate was amazing. We were steps away from everything! The beds were so comfortable and the temperature was perfect. The bathroom was huge and had a seperate area for makeup, hair etc which was wonderful since we had 3 girls in the room. The only issue with the bathroom was the shower door not closing all the way. I would like to stay here each and everytime I come to Chicago. I only hope the next time I can meet Jermaine the manager. I looked for him but was never able to catch him

Reviews.Title: “convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: teach2phish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello Hotel the second week of October. Having never been to Chicago before, we searched around for the best deals and locations on hotels. Unfortunately, there were also about 30,000 people in the city for various conferences, which left the hotel prices quite high, and often sold out. We used priceline to get this hotel, and were quite pleased with our stay. Conveniently located (10 minute walk to the Red Line) and cheaper overnight parking than many places ($26/night). Easy check in - courteous, if not friendly, staff. The room was great. Comfortable (almost too soft, but high quality) bed, nice sheets and blankets. Spacious enough for us. The half-wall shower is kind of a fail. The floor/towel was soaked after each use no matter how careful we were. We were glad to have a separate changing/makeup area and a mini-fridge in the room. Loved the fact that the windows opened, so we could get the great fall air. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around, still great.”
Reviews.Author: Roslyn D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Raffaello 2 years ago and again last month. The first time, I thought it was quite possibly the nicest hotel I had ever stayed in. This time around, it seemed a little familiar, like an old friend, who had aged a little. However, it was still a really great experience. The location is very handy to the Magnificent Mile, the service is very good and the room neat and clean. My only negative comment was the price of the internet and the fact that it was annoying to have to call down to the front desk to get a new password every 24hours. I would probably stay here again though, even if i wasn't on a work trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: xty314
Reviews.Content: Great location in proxemity to Michigan Ave. shopping. Hotel was very contemporary & inviting. Rooms are spacious, clean & comfortable. Staff was friendly & accomdating.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: collegemomIowa
Reviews.Content: My bookclub reserved 8 rooms here for a 1 day trip to Chicago. The location was perfect and the price reasonable for that location. The staff was so helpful - we had to store our luggage because we got to the hotel before check-in time, then the next day they let us store our luggage after check-our since our train did not leave for several hours. The room was clean and comfortable and we took advantage of the coffee/bar area in the lobby. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Fin W
Reviews.Content: This was the first visit to Chicago for my wife and I. We really enjoyed our experience. The hotel is only a block away from the Magnificent Mile so the location is about as good as you can get. The hotel was very clean as was our room. The staff were all very helpful and if we were to return to Chicago we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Few Disappointments”
Reviews.Author: rporta
Reviews.Content: We travel frequently and I always look on TripAdvisor for reviews before we make reservations. Unfortunately with this hotel, there was a conference in Chicago the weekend we were there on September 16 so there weren't a lot of hotel choices available when we booked our stay. We booked two rooms for two couples with the boutique hotel. Normally I enjoy staying at a boutique hotel because the hotel is not massive and the staff are friendly. However, this boutique hotel had some disappointments that we've not experienced previously. Pros: - The location is great if you desire to be near Michigan Avenue. It's literally a short walk to the magnificent mile so it's very convenient. - The price was less, especially for that location at the time. I also noticed they had a special on their website that was even better than what we paid. - The lobby area was clean as was both rooms. Cons: - The staff was not very friendly throughout our visit. From the moment we arrived, we received no help with the door nor our luggage. I will explain more about the staff below. - The elevators are very small so we had to wait for an elevator at times since they fit two people comfortably, especially if someone has luggage. - There wasn't any place to eat for breakfast at the hotel, not even a continental breakfast choice. - The lobby and bar area is also small so there is not a lot of seating available. - There were very intoxicated people who who entered the hotel and were not guests. I do not know if this is because of the location of the hotel or not but the doorman had to be notified by another guest who then went to "find" the intoxicated people. Had the doorman been at the door in the first place, maybe he would have seen them come into the hotel himself. - The fitness area was small and most of the equipment was broken, although there wasn't any signage on the equipment noting it was not working. - Our rental car was parked in their parking lot across the street and was damaged by another vehicle in the parking lot during our stay. The manager of the parking lot said they were not responsible even though an employee of the parking lot was aware of the damage. We were not able to reach a manager at the hotel when we checked-out because the person at the front desk said that a manager was not present (poor customer service). We were given a phone number in which to call the manager at another time. After multiple calls to the manager of the hotel, who also denied any responsibility, we were provided with a credit for the parking lot fee for the night but nothing for the damage on the vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back.”
Reviews.Author: dijas
Reviews.Content: Note...if you are a member of Hotels.com, I've posted this review there, as well. We went to the Rafaello for Labor Day weekend. We were there a few years ago after their renovation, so we knew it was nice. We had a smaller (standard) room this time, but it was still well-appointed. The bed was very comfortable and I liked the little space between the bath and the bedroom for the mini-bar and dressing area. Other things I like: wonderful Gilchrest and Soames bath products! I liked that they didn't skimp and give you 2:1 shampoo:conditioner - I hate that. Towels were o.k., and we had plenty. For a four star hotel, we did not receive any additional amenities such as a shower cap or mending kit, however. The t.v. was great and we got an upgraded cable package with AMC and extra channels. Temperature was easy to control in the room and did not drift (which is sometimes a problem).

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel,”
Reviews.Author: sonido321
Reviews.Content: horrible experience. people that work in the hotel are not very nice. we asked for some tourism information and a map and we were told to take brochures from the desk, that all we had to know was there. situation: regular, just near john hancock observatory, far away from other Rooms were quite dirty and with a lot of noice, we had problems to sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LCraig2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel twice and enjoyed both visits very much! Old, refurbished hotel, small, PERFECT location! Just off N. Michigan Ave., easy walk to the lake and so much more. Not fancy but charming and the staff tries to accomodate any requests. Very reasonably priced for where it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LAK1113
Reviews.Content: I use to stay at this hotel years ago before it was redone on trips to Chicago. Planning a last mintue trip last weekend to Chicago I had decided to book this hotel as I was looking for a decent sized double room, moderately prices in a great location and most hotels were sold out that weekend. So I went back to a hotel that in the past did not disappoint. I was pleasantly surprized as they seemed to have done a decent job with the lobby area and adding a restuarant next door (which I did not have a chance to eat at). Overall the room was pretty good. Beds were comfortable but pillows were too soft for me. The room was large and spacious. The only thing that bothered me was that the bathroom was small and had no countertops. This bothers me as you dont have anywhere to put your bathroom stuff. The shower had no door but a half piece of glass, which was alright if you know to put a towel down across the front of the whole shower, otherwise it will be very wet. One thing I did notice is that the daily internet price is very reasonable at $9.95 a day. The room had a nice desk, big flat screen TV, table with chairs nice area with single serve coffee pot, big fridge etc. The location really is the thing about this hotel...and when you come to Chicago and do some shopping you really cant complain about the proximity to Water Tower Place or shopping on Michigan. The hotel is not a bells and whistles type of place but it works out well when you need a large room with two double beds...as most in Chicago can tend to be small. I do recommend this hotel for its proximity and reasonable price (even on an expensive weekend). But if you are looking for a bit more opulence, I recommend staying at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bad choice”
Reviews.Author: ellensuzanne
Reviews.Content: where to begin....by far the worst hotel we have ever stayed in!!! our room smelled like sewage, the only remedy the staff could think of was to pour mr clean down the shower drain...told us a mgr would call...never heard from anyone....my kids' room had no air conditioning....so they moved our rooms.....again problems.....the bathroom door handle in my kids' room fell off and they could not use the bathroom....all of this would not be so bad if it were not for the attitude of the staff....unhelpful and soooo rude!!!!!! awful hotel....and such a shame because we love chicago!!!!! please stay somewhere other than the raffaello

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever in all Chicago, perfect hotel for a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: djraffi
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location, this place has it. Right across the street form the John Hancock tower and right on the magnificent mile. An ideal location if your looking to shop! Everything else was great. The room was super clean. Carpet was spotless. And the bathroom...I could have lived in there! It was all beautiful titles and sparkly. We love staying here whenever I come to Chicago. The service is great, the rooms are fabulous with most comfortable hotel bed ever and we have never had a bad experience. We highly recommend Raffaello Hotel for your stay in Chicago nowhere else

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTING!”
Reviews.Author: Lezlie M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for one night last weekend. It was a bad experience. The rooms smelled terrible (a musty or moldy smell), the air conditioner was loud and rattling, the lock on the door looked as though someone had tried to jimmy it open, the bathroom was not clean (there were literally hairs stuck to the walls!), and the room phone did not work. After being moved for a second time (yes, we were in three different rooms), we realized that all of the rooms were very sub-standard. If it hadn't been late at night, we would surely have moved elsewhere. The front desk was totally unhelpful, and acted like were were too picky. The location is great, but this place is a disaster!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location! Fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: Lenadog
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Raffaello this past week. I booked our stay directly through their website for a standard king room (avg. $120/night). We were pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded to a suite w/o us saying a word. All amentities listed on the website were included including the Keurig coffee maker with liquid creamer (yeah!). Loved the slippers and robes. The pillows were great and the bed firm, which my husband loved. The only negative was the wireless connection. It was very poor and at $9.95, we weren't very happy. But when I asked them to remove the charge, they did without a fuss. BTW...there is complimentary wireless in the lobby. The bar at Raffaello was great. Had a chocolate martini at the end of the night and it was delicious. BTW...in the morning, there is coffee and tea available in to-go cups. We self-parked on Chestnut not knowing where we could park (I didn't call ahead). It cost us $28.00/24 hours with no in/out priveleges. This garage was next to the Seneca Hotel. The best part of the Raffaello is it's location. It is one block from Michigan Ave. (Mag Mile) and across the street from John Hancok and the Water Tower. We caught the 146 bus a block away, which took us to the Museum Campus ($2.25 per trip). It was two blocks from the 66 bus which took you to Navy Pier. Within a 3 to 4 block radius there are a number of great restaurants. Based on the value and location, we will definitely recommend the hotel to anyone looking to visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “charming & good value”
Reviews.Author: hpullem
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel one block off the Magnificent Mile (Bloomingdales, Macy's, etc). Large room, well appointed, very comfortable. I'd definitely stay here again. The only negative is the small, slow elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lawflake
Reviews.Content: I liked the proximity to the Maginificant Mile and lots to do. It is especially nice to have the Contemporary Art Museaum so close. Rooms are nice and fresh with lots of comforts. Staff was helpful and price is low for the area.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: HalifaxGreg
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the Raffaello in Chicago. It is located behind Water Tower Place and is walking distance to all of the major attractions. The hotel looks old from the outside, but my room was recently renovated. It was modern and fresh. The bathroom was a wow, with a great showerhead and glass shower. The housekeeping attention to detail was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: C E
Reviews.Content: Last minute couples weekend in Chicago and sort randomly picked this hotel because of availability, price, proximity to Michigan Ave., and the website seemed cool. We were hoping the website wasn't overpromising (as some do) especially since our friends on the trip booked this hotel solely on our recommendation. To our relief, we weren't disappointed! The hotel definitely has a European feel. Our room was clean, nicely appointed, & had a comfortable bed. We enjoyed the in-room extras (Keurig coffee, moderately priced in-room beverages, & iHome for our ipod). Our room location was quiet even though it faced the street. We were impressed when we observed the manager advising staff members to take care of certain finer details in the lobby. They had fresh coffee and water available in the lobby bar area throughout the day which was a nice touch when returning to the hotel after a morning/afternoon excursion in the city. The concierge's recommendations for places to eat or get drinks were spot on. One minor negative was that the air conditioner in our room didn't get quite as cool as we had preferred but it wasn't unbearable or worth a call to maintenance. We'd like to return some day and would recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Raffaello and DePaul Basketkball in the same week”
Reviews.Author: Keywestnays
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, especially after check in. The hotel was great and it was in the best part of the city. We got to enjoy the City and when ask where we were staying everyone said you are in the best, we agreed. My wife and I were in the city for the first time to see my high school teammate and now Head Men's Basketball Coach for DePaul University, Oliver Purnell. They playe Villanova at the All State Arena. Staff gave us great direction for the public transportation and for the other sites. Being from Maryland, staying on East Delaware Place made us feel right at home, since Delaward in next to Maryalnd. We had a great time due to our stay at the Raffaello, except the elavators were a little tight. We will be back in February again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: CAHoya
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a handful of times now while traveling to Chicago for work, the most recent time being early August 2011. The hotel is conveniently located one block behind the Hancock Building, on a relatively quiet side street that is convenient to Michigan Avenue, as well as to the lakefront. Front desk service has always been prompt and friendly. There's a small bar off the lobby that has coffee in the mornings. I haven't visited the bar, but there are typically a few guests there in the evenings. It looks like a nice place for a quiet drink. Being an older building, the rooms themselves are on the small side, but appear to have been recently renovated, and are clean and comfortable. For a business trip where I'm not spending time in the room, this place is perfect. My one gripe with the hotel is that the two elevators are both very small. During peak hours, there tends to be a wait, and/or you get to crowd in with others.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: dawnjoy
Reviews.Content: Well, this was my daughter's first trip to the city and the Raffaello Hotel helped to make it special for her. A perfect location, very centrally located next to both the Water Tower Place and the Hancock Tower. Our trip to the American Girl Doll store was just 2 blocks away! There are many great restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We found the staff to be very helpful and courteous and the room was absolutely elegant. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't everything we'd hoped it would be”
Reviews.Author: B M
Reviews.Content: I've never written one of these before, but having visited Chicago a number of times over the past couple years and selecting to stay at a different hotel each time, I've seen what is out there and what you get for your money. We chose the Raffaello because of its location, and because the deluxe suite seemed to be a good value. We requested an upper floor when we made the reservations, and we were given a room on the 10th floor facing west towards Michigan Avenue, as requested. All good, but our room wasn't ready at 4 pm, the check-in time. We were told several times that it wasn't cleaned yet, and finally were allowed to go up around 4:45 pm. The room was clean, and large, but there were dings and dents and mismatched paint, the carpet seemed dirty with water spots? and in general was a bit dingy. The sofa bed was awful - it sagged in the middle even without our 2 kids in it. Any movement and you could feel the springs/coils and it made a lot of noise. It really was sub-par. The king bed in the room was very nice and my wife and I slept great. We had no trouble with the air conditioning, and the updated bath was nice, probably the nicest thing about the room. We went to the fitness center and were surprised how small it was - the pictures on-line appear to show many machines, but as it turns out the walls are mirrored and this gives the appearance of more equipment than there is. Still, there was no one there so it was easy to get a work-out in. Staff was nice and friendly and accommodating overall. Overall, though, not so great for the money, and probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad News”
Reviews.Author: Marla H
Reviews.Content: Arriving July 29th around 3:00, a co-worker and I immediately noticed how warm the lobby was and everyone appeared sweaty and red-faced. I asked why it was so warm and was told that the air conditioning was being fixed. We thought we'd go to the roof top to relax, since we couldn't check in till 4:00, and were told it was closed and "under construction". The photo on their website shows a beautiful roof top deck and says nothing about being closed, though the clerk disputed this. So, I guess the "umbrella rentals" refers to the rain type. The rooms (we had 3) were HOT and smelled musty. After a sleepless night, I complained about the heat and it was insulting to have the clerk act like they didn't notice. She offered to store my luggage and change my room, to which I responded "it's not my room, it's the hotel". She had the nerve to say that no one else had said anything, eventhough I heard numerous guests complaining in the elevators. A housekeeper brought a fan to my room, which helped somewhat. Another guest was told to go to the pharmacy up the street to get a fan and he would be reimbursed. It was a different excuse, problem and timeline for the AC fix, depending on who you spoke with. On the last day, there was a slight cooling effect. Yes, they have a business office, but there's a charge to use the computer. You can print a boarding pass free, but the printer didn't work. Why not just MAN UP, admit there were problems, apologize, offer room discounts, free drinks at the bar (which is closed 2 days), fans for everyone...anything that might be respectful of the guests and an effort at customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: BeachLovingFamilyCO
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Raffaello Chicago. The location was fantastic -- a block west of Lake Michigan and a block east of Michigan Avenue. The John Hancock building was right outside our window. The room was clean and spacious with modern decor. We had a small refrigerator/mini bar and coffee maker in the room. My parents were traveling with us, and they had a suite which was very nice as well, and was a true one bedroom suite with a door between the bedroom and the sitting area. The only negative thing I can think of to say was that the shower was poorly designed - water got all over the floor - and the elevators were tiny, but that's to be expected in such an old building. We walked to Navy Pier, had lunch at Margaritaville and then took a water taxi to the Shedd Aquarium. We had pizza at Gino's East and cocktails on the 96th floor of the John Hancock building. We took in a Cubs game at Wrigley Field. There is so much to see and do in Chicago, and the train was a short walk from the hotel, so we didn't have to drive anywhere. Would recommend the Raffaello, and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “If I traveled to Chicago more, this is where I'd stay!”
Reviews.Author: mvparker2010
Reviews.Content: In January 2011, my mother and I flew from California to Chicago for a family funeral. We weren't too excited at the prospect of flying from our "winter weather" of 65 degrees into a real winter of snow and freezing temperatures, but the Raffaello made it so much more enjoyable. My mom, who doesn't frequently stay in hotels or travel much, loved the atmosphere and said it was the most comfortable bed she'd ever slept in! I loved the fitness room and enjoyed running on the treadmill while watching the snow fall in the morning. We also took advantage of the business center to print our boarding passes, which was a big plus. The location to shopping and restaurants was fabulous, and everyone on staff we came into contact with was extremely pleasant. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: hiba26
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel with my family,we booked the deluxe suite it was very clean & the beds was very comfortable,we had 2 LCD one in the bedroom with a DVD player & the other one in the living room,we had a microwave,fridge. the hotel location was perfect it was 5 minutes walking to the water park which is a perfect shopping center & you can find some restaurants.if i will visit Chicago again i would stay at his hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE, NICE STAFF ---STILL HAVING A/C ISSUES”
Reviews.Author: Filthymitten
Reviews.Content: Conflicting stories on the AC issue. While they did give us the option of a 50% discount or 100% refund. when I told some of the staff members that I read a post from the manager saying they had recently replaced the A/C system, I was told that was not true and that it has not been working properly for weeks. They did give us a box fan that made the room tolerable. So again, no complaints other than what appears to have been misinformation posted here. Just a word to the wise..

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia1270
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at Raffaelo and it was again, wonderful. Perfect location, comfortable, elegant rooms and terrific staff. It is our go to place now in Chicago. Our daughter has moved to Chicago so we will be visiting several times a year and the Raffaelo will always be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been nice.....if the A/C worked....and they didn't lie about it....”
Reviews.Author: sarayoungsandiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because of the location and the fact that it was a smaller, boutique hotel. It looked really cute online. Also, it had a fitness center. Being an avid runner but not used to heat and humidity I was looking forward to being able to keep up my mileage while on vacation. The hotel is right next door to the John Hancock building and 2 blocks from the water. We arrived on July 21st, right in the middle of a nasty heatwave. The temperature was over 90 degrees and had been for several days. We walked into the lobby and immediately noticed how warm it was. The employee that checked us in told us that the A/C had been down since Monday and it was just fixed that morning and the hotel would be cooled down in a few hours. Annoyed but trying to keep positive, we get into our room and the A/C was on full blast, set to 50 degrees but the air coming out wasn't cold, wasn't even cool. We went out for about 4 hours and returned expecting coolness but Surprise! no change whatsoever. I talked to the same employee that checked us in and got a somewhat rude response. She said "like I told you earlier, its going to take a few hours to cool down." At this point it had been about 12 hours since the A/C was "fixed". After a sweat-soaked night of tossing and turning, we went to the front desk and inquired again. Now we were told that the A/C has a new problem and should be fixed that day. This was Friday morning. Needless to say, we checked out on Monday and the A/C never worked the entire time we were there. I understand that things like this happen, but what boiled my blood was the fact that they lied to us every single day, telling us the A/C was going to be fixed that day. Also their indifference was annoying. They never apologized once and acted like it was no big deal. When it's 95 degrees with 90% humidity, it is a big deal! We asked to be compensated in some way for our inconvenience. We were told that since we booked and paid through Expedia, we had to worked with Expedia to get money back. So I called Expedia that night, they put me on hold and tried to call the hotel. The hotel hung up on them twice and then put them (and me) on hold for 45 minutes before I gave up. So we got nothing. If this hadn't happened, I would have given this hotel 2 thumbs up. But since they screwed us over so bad, I am not even going to tell you what was nice about this place. At this point, I wonder if they even have A/C at all!! Beware of this place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Your Money”
Reviews.Author: SimplyGourmet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a weekend and totally thought it was a great bargain. We wanted to stay in the city at a decent price hotel and I looked this hotel up on Yelp. Its a small boutique hotel which has been well renovated. Rooms are big and spacious and bed is very confortable. The location is perfect as its close to good shopping and restaurants. Would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Despite A/C issue the hotel took good care of us”
Reviews.Author: KandCtravelers
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Raffaello on 7/24/11 to find the A/C was only partially functioning. It was too late to book another hotel at a good rate and we had tkts for a long awaited Cubs game that afternoon. We were frustrated that we didn't receive advance notification of the problem and when I expressed this to mgmt. we were immediately given the option to cancel or choose from several upgraded room options within the hotel at a significant discount. The manager showed us our choices so we could select the space that was the best. We ended up in a lovely room with mostly working a/c and our rate was discounted without question. What could have been a nightmare vacation was excellent due to the caring staff. Great location and in room plus in lobby free coffee an added plus. We'll gladly return to the Raffaello!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room,but air conditioning needs work”
Reviews.Author: PhilK58
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here two nights during a heat wave and it never was really cool in our room. The A/C gave us some relief, but it wasn't enough. Besides that, the room was more than we had hoped for. You are right next door to the John Hancock building, so all the conveniences of the magnificant Mile are right there. The room was much larger than most rooms and very nciely decorated. Fantastic shower! You can use the parking garage across the street instead of the valet to save sme money. It's still fairly expensive, but that is to be expected in downtown Chicago. If they could just get the A/C right, it would've been perfect

Reviews.Title: “No air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: CarynPadilla
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to check into the hotel yesterday but upon arrival were told the air conditioning wasn't working. It was 92 degrees! Funny, when I spoke to the concierge two hours before our arrival, he didn't mention that small detail. We had no place to stay that night and it ruined our weekend. My kids were crushed.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to my next stay!”
Reviews.Author: SharonYza
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, everything we needed was in walking distance. We had a Suite which was very roomy, clean and comfortable with comfortable beds. There was a microwave and refrigerator in the room. Bathroom was shower only. Free Internet in the Hotel Lobby and Internet available in the rooms for an additional rate. There is small bar located in the hotel lobby, nice for an evening drink. A restaurant is off of the hotel lobby with inside and outside dining. (Never had the opportunity to try it). The staff was friendly and helpful and always had a smile. Our stay was great and I look forward to a return stay on our next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: evergreen30
Reviews.Content: Located in the center of the Gold Coast/Magnificent Mile next to the Hancock Building, the Raffaello used to be the Rafael, but has been totally remodeled. We had two rooms and for one we were upgraded to a large corner suite at no extra charge. Free coffee and wi-fi in the lobby, but they charge for both in your room. Our room was equiped with a microwave, bar sink and refrigerator. Remolded bathroom was luxurious. Excellent concierge service. We walked everywhere - no need to have a car. Air conditioning unit was noisy in one room while the other one was quiet. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Spot In The Heart of The City”
Reviews.Author: mcfaddenkerri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello for four days for our first family vacation and I would definitely stay again! Our train got in at 11am and although check-in time was at 4pm they allowed us to check right into our one-bedroom suite. The room was fabulous and enough space for my husband and I as well as our 3 teenagers. The bathroom was perfect and the shower was amazing. The only complaint was that for the price of the room they should have free-wifi available to their guests and there was no pool; the wifi was only free in the lobby which was fine, but it made it kind of difficult to Skype our in-laws on a daily basis. This hotel is right off of Michigan ave and 2 minutes away from John Hancock so it was in the heart of everything, but when you turned the corner it was like you were removed from the sights and sounds of the big city. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: oaktownCA
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay downtown for a week while in Chicago on business. Many of the other hotels were sold out or asking $600 a night since there was a large convention in town. I was able to get the largest room at the Raffaello for less than half of that. I walked everywhere from this quiet, but in the middle of it all location, and the lake is one block away. I booked the room with a business package that gave me free wifi, though I did have to call down every night to get a new password. The bed was comfortable, the room was huge, the windows actually opened, and the bathroom was spacious. It felt more like a city apartment more than a hotel. There were two nice flat screen tvs in the room, and a ipod docking clock stereo. The small kitchenette was useful since I was staying for more than a few days. I was disappointed to find the roof deck closed while I was there. I am sure the view is amazing towards the lake. The elevators are small, though I was traveling alone and it didnâ€™t really affect me. I didnâ€™t try the restaurant or room service, but there are many amazing places to eat close by. The lobby is small though nice. I am not one to hang around the lobby of a hotel so I didnâ€™t feel anything was missing. I am coming back to Chicago in July for business with my entire team and I plan on booking rooms for everyone. I found my new go to hotel in the Windy City. Just hope they get the roof fixed soon!

Reviews.Title: “Really Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DoodleLoveX2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Chicago for a Jazz Weekend. We went to the Green Mill. Loved it! Upon entering the Hotel it seemed very small. I guess because the Hotel Lounge is very small and pristine. When we entered our room, we could not believe how small it was. Tiny. They brag about their linens and showers. Nothing special, in fact I felt the shower needed work. Did not look very clean. Toiletries were average. the air conditioner did not work right. We were warm most of the time. If you want to shut the bathroom door, you must first remove a shoulder. Carpet was old and filthy. Overall, they think more of their hotel than we did. The one and only thing this hotel has going for it is their location.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Baddydaddy
Reviews.Content: This place entices you with an attractive location and competitive price, but that is all you get. The rest is a low-budget product at a four-star price. Clowny staff, drab decor, etc. makes this a one-timer. I won't be fooled back here. The 72-hour cancellation policy should have given this craphole away.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: musicetc123
Reviews.Content: We were quite disappointed in this 4 star hotel. We were there w/ a large wedding party (18 rooms), but they refused to give us the wedding discount for the third night, even though others got it. Service was poot -- doorman did nothing, housekeepers forgot to leave coffee, the front desk called us at midnight by mistake. Pillows were large and hard, and left me with a sore neck. The only nice thing -- the suite w/ 2 separate rooms was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location- - -”
Reviews.Author: UMworldtravel
Reviews.Content: Some people prefer to stay in the Loop area, but I much prefer the North/Gold Coast area, where the Raffaello Hotel is located. Some travellers may remember this hotel from many years ago, when it was the boutique hotel Raphael. Its location is literally in the block behind the Hancock Building and one block further is Water Tower Plaza shopping. The Rafaello has have good updates/renovations, but customers need to remember that this is an old building and thus, room size varies and bathrooms are small due to this fact. Hallway noise isn't terrible, but if you are a light sleeper, this may be an issue. Room rates are competitively priced with other hotels of similar quality in the area. Beds and bed linens are very comfortable; towels are thick cotton and the addition of bathrobes is much appreciated. Housekeeping was OK: glass ware was not replaced and bathrooms need a better scrub. Front desk and door assistance was pleasant and helpful. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite-I have no idea why (perhaps since I had booked early and perhaps they had overbooked lesser cost rooms?) but I certainly enjoyed the extra space: a surprise luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Very Fari....much better in Chicago than this....”
Reviews.Author: ahe23
Reviews.Content: Stayed there this past weekend for 3 nights. We got a good deal on a suite from Quikbook but this is an old condo building converted into a hotel. The elevator situation sucks as you can't even fit in the elevator with your bags. There were 4 of us and 2 small kids. As a result you wind up waiting for elevators every single time you want to leave. The front desk is rude and doesn't get customer service and they barely speak english or understand how to deal with people. The room was big but that was about it. It was dark, dingy and was a half hearted attempt at a conversion with thermostats half hanging off the wall, no lights, etc. My daughter is allergice to feather pillows so called down to ask for FOAM and they send up feather pillows. I call down to complian and they finally send up the right ones but on one could have cared. Maybe they would have if I sued them after an allergic reaction. We travel all the time and am from Chicago and decided to try this place. Never again as there are far better in Chicago as there is little service and they could care less about trying to make it nice there. Place sucks and you can do far better. This is the first time I have ever posted and felt the need as besides a big room there was no other redeeming quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: gray_goose007
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife and 11 yr old daughter stayed at the Raffaello because we wanted to stay in a hotel that was in downtown chicago and close to everything, which this hotel was. I got a nice price for two night on priceline a doulble queen bed, which when we got to the room the beds looked like twin beds, but for almost 400 a night the room was real nice. Flat screen Tv, Super soft beds, ipod clock radio, walkin shower (no jet tub) nice up scale bathroom, robe in the closet, sprits, candy, pop, beer all at your choice, but they hold 200 dollars on your credit card up front in case up open up some of that stuff. The room service food was way to pricey, the resturant was way to pricey. We had to walk down to State street to get some breakfast and dinner. So if your going with just the Grown folk this place is cool. But if your taking kids, find one whats more kid friendly because this place is not.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale lodging at an affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: growler69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Raffaello for the first time because my usual place (Westin on Michigan Ave) was booked out. The Raffaello is just kitty-corned from the Westin on Delaware Place and offers convenient access to the Miracle Mile and to the Northwestern medical campus. As promised, the hotel was recently renovated and offers upscale looking decor and amenities (see pictures). Staff was pleasant and helpful and for $150/night, it was a good value. I was upgraded to a small suite at no extra charge and they threw in free internet, which I could not get to work, but i think that was the fault of our company's screwy computers. Did not eat at the hotel's restaurant so cannot comment on that. Seemed to be mostly leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: uncle_stu66
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel one block from Michigan Ave. We spend about half our time in Chicago at the American Girl Store, and this location worked out very well. The rooms are for the most part, different sizes and shapes. Our room was very comfortable for 2 adults and 2 children. Our room, which was not a suite, was square as opposed to the normal rectangle shaped room. The room had a good size open area with a table and chairs that gave us plenty of room to move around. The furniture was all good quality and in very good condition. The mattresses where terrific and must have been new. The carpet was clean and in very good condition as where all linens. My wife is very picky about carpet and linens, and this hotel passed her inspection. The bathroom was very large and has been renovated using quality materials and fixtures. The staff was professional and very helpful. We arrived on Thanksgiving Day and the front desk person made several calls to locate a restaurant that was open. We thought the hotel was a good value as well. We go to Chicago every year and have spend alot more at several hotels and gotten alot less. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great besides two things”
Reviews.Author: AdamM1986
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Raffaello for 4 nights. It was nice being right off North Michigan Avenue. The hotel's location made it extremely easy to walk to multiple restaurants, stores, the beach, Navy Pier, and Lincoln Park Zoo. We stayed in a spacious suite that had 2 televisions. We were given a free upgrade to the suite. This hotel could have got a 5/5 if the Sun Deck would have been open (closed for remodeling), and the room did not faintly smell like sewage. We left the sink drain plugged for most of our stay and the smell still wafted into the sleeping area. I do not know if this is an issue with the venting, or if all the rooms have this odor, but it was unpleasant. Fortunately, there is plenty to do in Chicago and you do not have to sit in your room everyday. Overall, I would say that we will probably stay here in the future, if these two concerns are addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Franny568
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel based on reviews. When checking in the check in desk didn't have our reservation. They gave it away to another person with a "similar" last name then went into panic mode because they were sold out. Finally after 35 minutes they found a room. On our second day when we returned to our room after a day of shopping and seeing the city I walked into the bathroom to see a massive COCKROACH. My husband killed it and we went down to bring the manager up. Although the manager on duty was very kind and moved our room it was very difficult to sleep in the hotel and thankfully we checked out the next day. Upon checkout not even an apology from the day manager or front desk. They couldn't even get our name right at checkout. I will NEVER stay at this hotel AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: civdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, to spend some time in Chicago. The hotel was clean and looked very nice. The rooftop was closed due to unknown reasons. We had a room that sleeps five but only given a couple towels and pillows. The toilet seemed like it was going to fall off the wall. The second bed in the room was extremely uncomfortable and dipped in the middle. The website advertised internet but failed to mention its cost an additional 9.99. parking another 30 and a roll-away bed for 25. Loved the location but wasn't worth what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “nice quiet location, great folks”
Reviews.Author: Beachwriter1
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Not much of a view out my window, but the room was roomy and clean. I could wish for a magnifying mirror (for contact wearers and putting on makeup) and more plugs for charging things. The little fridge was helpful. Housekeeper was a sweetheart. Planning to return in June which is probably the best endorsement yet.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: lovebossa
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at Raffaello. I was there for two nights for a conference with a friend of mine. As you enter the hotel, you enjoy a nice decor - and you can have iced water to refresh anytime at the lobby. I would not call the room the most spacious but the room was large enough for two people. The room has a big window, and I liked the details of the room. The bed was very comfortable so as the nice sofa in the room. I found the in-room amenity was slightly limited for a four-star hotel, but the shower was very soothing and relaxing. I also enjoyed the bathrobe. Despite the very convenient location, the hotel was very quiet, and we had a hard time getting up in the morning. The hotel staff were very friendly overall. The concierge, Jered, has been especially helpful for choosing the room and a restaurant nearby. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Fuchsinn
Reviews.Content: Very quiet and nice hotel, close to shopping mall and lake. They don't include breakfast but the room is equipped with coffee machine and microwave. We have comfortable stay there. I would recommend Rafaello Hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Daffodilly
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here with a seven year old. The location is great for shopping and tourist attractions. It is four or five blocks to the red line CTA stop. The hotel was clean and quiet and met our needs very well.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break American Girl Trip”
Reviews.Author: jdexteriii
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Raffaello Hotel. Rooms were extremely comfortable, clean and updated. The location was perfect for our first site seeing "Chicago Spring Break" mother and young daughter getaway. Bus stops to local museums and Shedd Aqauarium were easy to get to and the " Water Tower Plaza - American Girl Place " was just a few steps away . Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Unwanted pest!”
Reviews.Author: faithyMichigan
Reviews.Content: We had a rather unpleasant experience with our stay at the Rafaello. When we checked in we were very pleased with the location, and overall appearance of the hotel, however, when we entered our room, and opened the bathroom door we were very shocked to see a large insect laying on its back on the bathroom floor. Barely alive we gathered that it had been possibly sprayed in there before we arrived. We did call down to the front desk, and had it promptly removed, but we had a rather uneasy feeling for the duration of our stay. I don't know if the hotel has problem with pests, or if this was just a unfortunate incident.

Reviews.Title: “surpassed our high expectations”
Reviews.Author: Uniqueday
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at this upscale boutique hotel surpassed our high expectations. We travel for business and pleasure around the world, and have had many wonderful experiences during these travels. Raffaello Hotel is next door to the John Hancock Building, 1 block from the Chicago Water Tower on the Miracle Mile.The location is convenient the public transportation, within walking distance of many hot spots, and has inexpensive in-and-out parking. From the doormen to the front desk staff and housekeeping, you will not meet a group of people who give better service with smiles on their faces. The superb fitness center is a added bonus. Our suite was surprisingly roomy , the separate bedroom and large bathroom with glass shower made relaxing on this "girl getaway" weekend easy! Great views, wonderful linens, cozy sofa and chairs were all designed for relaxing and de-stressing. Scheduling a weekend away with my busy professional daughters is difficult and rare, it was therefore important to me that our lodging be wonderful. And it was, in every single way. I give Raffaello Hotel the highest recommendations. We will be back again, hopefully in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location But Beware of Hidden Fees”
Reviews.Author: mrjosher
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Westin on Michigan Avenue for my Chicago business trips but the Westin was booked this past week. I opted for the nearby Raffaello. It was in a great location with sizable, updated rooms and a well kept, intimate lobby area. My biggest complaint is that I scheduled a conference room in the lobby area which I thought was only going to cost me $250. I received a bill for $435 which included service charges and cable charges. I would have thought that these fees would have been waived since we had 7 guests staying in the hotel. I do not like surprises and will not be coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, quiet get-away in perfect location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithmom86
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Raffaello Hotel in Chicago, just steps away from Water Tower Place and Michigan Avenue. We felt as if we were in a quaint botique hotel in New York City with so much to see and do at our footsteps. The hotel staff was extremely accommodating - they even gave us a Raffaello umbrella to take with us on a rainy day. The parking is very reasonable by Chicago standards with in and out privileges.
