We had the smaller of the suites and the living area was enormous. The beds and pillows were plush and the decor very updated and comfortable. The rooms were very clean. The front desk staff were so flexible; allowing us an hour early check in and an hour late check out. We felt like we were away for more than one single night! It was the perfect get-away, and we only live 1/2 hour away from the hotel! Well worth it! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkolenda
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Raffaello Hotel on girls weekend with sister-in-law and our 2 "of age" daughters. So pleased with the Raffaello! The decor had such an elegant feel, and yet was so comfortable. We felt totally spoiled by the amenities in our room and the feel of the hotel, right down to the friendly doorman with the very Russian hat. They had a very comfy/inviting lounge by the lobby that was very welcoming and because it was small in size one felt that you just wanted to visit with the other patrons there. The location was great for most everything we wanted to do, parking right across the street for such a reasonable fee. The Raffaello added to our fun time and I look forward to a return visit with my husband to catch a ball game this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Traveler -This one stands out!”
Reviews.Author: kacleveland
Reviews.Content: Hotel-Awesome. Service- Immediate, NO hidden charges. Rooms are elegant with crisp ironed sheets. Location -excellent!

Reviews.Title: “This boutique style hotel was romantic with a european appeal.”
Reviews.Author: Everybody's Mother
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Groupon. It was an advertise special but I contacted the hotel directly and I was able to get the same deal. I was apprehension initally because the hotel amenities were sounding to good to be true. Well, to my suprise the website is a true depiction of the hotel. My friend and I absolutely loved it and we are planning to return this summer. The best reception we encounter was getting out of the cab only to be greeted by a friendly doorman. He made us feel very special and welcome. The front desk staff, Earline was so helpful and personable. The lobby offers fresh flowers and an intimate lounge area for you to relax and meet other guests. Didn't have an opportunity to eat in the Italian restaurant in the lobby. I did hear from other guests that it was great. Once we entered into our room, it took my breath away. The decor had a european flair with all the modern convenience you want in a suite. The bed and bedding will have you sleeping in late! It was a total relaxing time. FYI, the bathroom is a little different. It doesn't offer much counter space for women and the shower door (glass) is a half door. This is very popular in Europe so don't plan on sharing a showere with a spouse or partner. This is minor adjustment but everything else I give it 5-stars. Excellent proximity to Michigan Avenue and the John Hancock building. Book early for the spring and summer!! Highly recommend it.....

Reviews.Title: “Great North Side Experience for a Southside Guy”
Reviews.Author: Mo-Billy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I both work downtown with a long commute to the south suburbs. We occassionly spend a Friday night in the city. The Raffaello is perfect for our night on the town. The location is great for walking to every thing near north. The suites are beautiful and roomy & very quiet. We love walking in the neighborhood. The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marisarmy
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was great. We got a good deal on the room and the staff were all very nice and housekeeping did a fantastic job. We had a double room and it was very big. The beds and pillows were really comfortable and I liked that it had a fridge and microwave so we could buy groceries across the street to save money (if you go there don't get salami it's $8!). There was even a shoe shiner in the room! The only problem we had was that when we checked out there was a valet charge to our room and we didn't even take a car with us but it was fixed immediatly so it wasn't even really a problem. Also happy with the location. 2 blocks to Michigan Ave, half a block to John Hancock building and water tower shops, 2 blocks to Lake Shore Dr and about 6-8 blocks to Rush St.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Great Rooms- Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Magnificent Mile Area of Chicago is one of my favorite cities to visit for business with the added benefit of the great city of Chicago-its food- buildings- museums- shopping- This hotel is perfectly situated in the heart of all of it. I had a beautiful room on the 17th floor (1705) Nice suite. Living room view is a shot toward the lake and bedroom the John Hancock Tower and Delaware Pl toward Michigan Ave. Spacious room- Could not expect more. The restaurant next door is terrific homemade Italian and I seriously suggest eating here! I booked through Expedia - so if the rates are consistant I will absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST small hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Lynda056
Reviews.Content: A recently updated hotel with great rooms, a great location, great beds, and great service! They've added a small hotel bar and have the most fabulous retaurant, Pelago, right next door (and we've eaten at most top Chicago restaurants so we know our food!). Return guests get a few perks in the form of upgrades, etc. An added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “great in every way”
Reviews.Author: mrstawingo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, helpful staff, clean and spacious rooms, great location - two blocks from Magnificent Mile, Museum of Contemporary Art, John Hancock Observatory, Broadway Playhouse, Macy's, great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: maritza_11
Reviews.Content: We would never book with this hotel ever again. After trying to cancel our reservation (death in family) 24 hrs. in advance we were informed that we would be charged 100% of the rate. Not wanted to give our money away we made the situation work. When we went to check in on Saturday night they informed us that the hotel was over sold and they had a room for us at the Hilton!!!! I don't think this is acceptable especially when I tried cancelling the reservation!! If I wanted to stay at the Hilton I would've booked us there. Too many great hotels in Chicago to put up with this crap!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful upscale boutique hotel with great rooms and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Castlecreek66
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The regular rooms are larger than normal with a really large bathroom. The suites are magnificent. The location couldn't get any better. You can walk to Rush Street and Water Tower Place and plenty of restaurants. The service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique style hotel with friendly staff and nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Hickmech
Reviews.Content: My son and I came to Chicago for a hockey game and were quite pleased with our stay at Raffaello. The location just off Michigan was close to good restuarants and stores and we were able to get around easily otherwise with public transportation and taxis. The room was spacious, comfortable and well appointed with nice amenities. It appeared to have been recently remodeled. The work out facility was well furnished as was the business center. Two, free newspapers were available in the lobby and though we did not eat there, they have what looks like a very nice restuarant. The elevators are "cozy", but were never a problem. With the internet rate we got, the value was quite good. We hope to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: k11111d
Reviews.Content: Spacious room and nice shower. Only coffee available in room and only supply for 2 cups. Water normally complimentary in most hotels was charged for here. Free wifi available in lobby only. Breakfast not served in restaurant only in room with an exhorbitant charge on top for service. Hotel food was quite expensive and not the best one could hope for. Toilet regularly kept getting blocked. Towels were sometimes stained and not clean as you would expect or as soft. Complimentary gym quite small. Universal electric toothbrush sockets not available in bathroom. Ipod / Iphone dock on clock allowing charging and playing tracks from own phone or ipod. Staff at front desk could be more welcoming with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Marvelous!!!”
Reviews.Author: vivron
Reviews.Content: Our suite was outstanding, spacious and tasteful. The bed was extremely comfortable. Staff was very attentive and pleasant. The only negative was that we both had a laptop and had to pay twice the fee for the wifi per day. I would think that one fee for the room would be enough- these days lots of couples have their own laptop for work or other ... The location couldn't be more perfect and the price is outstanding for the area. What a value! It's like finding a hidden treasure! We will definitely be back to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a hotel in need of face lift”
Reviews.Author: lysychka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great location, next to all atractions of the Magnificient Mile. We stayed in a 500 sq feet one bedroom suite. The furnishings are worn out, in need of updating. The kitchenette nook does not have a sink. They charged us $15 for 2 items from the minibar that we did not take. We tried to work it out with the management, but the hotel did not repond to our request. Cleaning was sloppy, never on time, staff was not very firendly. Small living space, carpet in need of repairs. No common area. $10 fee for the Internet. Tired hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “If in Chicago for RSNA or professional business of any kind, go anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: xraydoc_11
Reviews.Content: Clueless staff, management M.I.A. Office services unavailable when office is locked. Don't bother trying to reach management by phone or email after the fact to politely complain. You'll get no answer, no acknowledgement, no signs of life at all. Light's on, nobody's home. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location-Boutique Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: XVEGASGIRL
Reviews.Content: Stayed on January 6-9 and it was all I ever wanted in a hotel. Quiet, I even asked if I was the only one on my floor, 9th. The front desk, especially Ida, very knowledgeable, helpful, friendly. Doormen friendly and great cab hailers. Room was meticulous and more than enough tea and in room coffee, plus in the am, coffee/tea downstairs. Great rates, especially in January :) Would stay again.... and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: WldLuv2TravelMore
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful trip to the windy city as always. Stayed for the first time at the Raffaello although have stayed in this area prior, will now definetly come back to Raffaello. Staff was wonderful and loved the atmosphere~ What a nice change over the typical overlarge and impersonal these days.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy & Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Lfowlkes
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, contemporary decor, extremely clean. Friendly staff, shopping, restaurants in walking distance. Overall great Chicago location.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyfishingattorney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 309, a suite, and had a wonderful, flawless stay. The hotel is on Delaware just west of Michigan, a very short two blocks (about 100 paces) from the Water Tower Mall and Hancock Building entrances. All the best of the Magnificent Mile is within a very short walk. The Hotel is a stunning, boutique type property. The lobby is very elegant. The doormen were extremely polite and helpful as were the concierge and front desk staff. Our room was very spacious and beautifully furnished with comfortable furniture. There were large, brand new flat screen televisions in the sitting area and bedroom. The king sized bed was brand new and was incredibly comfortable. The bathroom featured a wonderful rainfall style showerhead. The bathroom was a good size for a property in the heart of downtown. The suite was so large that I could sit in the large living room area with the tv on without disturbing my wife who was sleeping. It also featured a very nice mini fridge and bar as well as a nice writing table and very comfortable, full size sofa. Housekeeping made the room spotless each day. Also, on New Year's Day we asked for our room to be cleaned while we stepped out for breakfast. This request was gladly accomodated. Also, as we were eating breakfast my wife recalled that she had left her engagement ring and diamond watch on the table in the bedroom in a spot the maid would be sure to see. We were very relieved that the ring and watch hadn't been touched and that was a huge relief. What a wonderful way to ring in the New Year. Last year we stayed at the downtown Hotel Intercontinental but we enjoyed the Raffaello much, much more. Terrific, not to be missed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Raffaello is a jewel of a hotel perfectly located in the heart of excellent shopping and great dining.”
Reviews.Author: joanne_lussier
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to have been given this recommendation. The Raffaello is beautifully positioned only a couple of blocks from the Magnificent Mile in a quiet corner of downtown Chicago. So much was within walking distance from this boutique hotel: the Chicago visitor's centre is just around the corner, numerous restaurants are scattered throughout the area and naturally, the shopping is fabulous. The hotel is warm and welcoming and, has up-to-date amenities yet is able to convey an old world charm. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would return again in a heartbeat. JoAnne & Keith True, Ottawa, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, comfortable, quiet & great location near the Water Tower.”
Reviews.Author: QueenofCaffeine
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Raffaello is conveniently located downtown & easy to access. The self park garage was the most reasonable downtown & the garage staff were very pleasant & helpful. Our room was clean, spacious, comfortable & quiet. We would stay here again, but would request several pods of coffee for the coffeemaker, instead of the one pod & mug provided. The waterfall shower is a dream!

Reviews.Title: “great, European style small hotel”
Reviews.Author: TooManyKids4
Reviews.Content: I left the Raffaello In late November after a very pleasant (as always) two-night stay. But I forgot my bag, including laptop etc., in the garage across the street when I was packing the car to depart. Didn't notice until I was back home. I called the hotel. Staff were very helpful. A valet ran across the street and retrieved my bag. I talked to the Sunday manager who arranged to have my bag shipped to me the next day. I've always liked the Raffaello. Now I'm a bigger fan than ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent European Style City Centre Location near Shopping/Sights”
Reviews.Author: WillT215
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a 2 day business meeting and my wife came along for leisure. The Bellman are courteous, quick and friendly upon arriving; and the front desk staff was so welcoming. Check in was quick, and we got to select a high or low floor. Location was unbeatable - 1 block from Hancock Tower, and 2 blocks from Water Tower Shopping/Restaurants, 900 N Michigan Shops, and many nice upscale restaurants to hip trendy coffee/sandwich shops. And I could walk to the office - even in the winter. Hotel amenities - large business center with printers/copiers and a flat screen. Best Rain Showers in US (I travel a lot) and most comfortable bedding. Would recommend, as price is extremely reasonable for downtown Chicago

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed.”
Reviews.Author: mzesguerra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and 7 days, we were in business. The hotel rate was really expensive but considering the location it was good. The nightmare begins when the airconditioning failed to work, the door keys never worked, and the thing that really pissed me off was we ordered room service and paid cash, the room service guy claimed that we never paid him any cash and so was charged twice. I tried to report the incident, I left messages, passed on to different people and it took over a month for them to reply just to find out that they were not going to refund me the money. NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL, THE STAFF WERE SNOBS AND NEVER ORDER ROOM SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: “It's sad when you tell them it's bad and they simply respond with "sorry"”
Reviews.Author: underwaterpiano
Reviews.Content: Let me say this up front. Although the hotel was very expensive (location based) I didn't pay for it as it was a business trip. My room was tiny, the bad was lumpy, and I stayed for 2 nights and didn't sleep at all for 2 nights. I am coming home exhausted from the hotel. I mentioned it to the front desk more than once and they did not seem at all concerned that my stay was not going well. There are too many good hotels in Chicago to put up with this sort of thing. Extremely dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: bbaerk
Reviews.Content: 11 women stayed on this trip (we had Oprah tickets). Awesome location. Rates were excellent for this class of hotel. Concierge, desk and bell staff took care of our transportation and other needs. Room lighting a little dim was my only complaint. Great combo of room selections - it was perfect for 2 (unrelated) people to share a room. Best shopping and restaurants just a few steps in high heels away and right next to Hancock Tower so if you have trouble with direction, you can find your way back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: pczerwinski
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to Chicago for 3 nights. Our first night we arrived at the hotel very late so we decided to visit the bar in the hotel rather than go out. Incredibly friendly bartender who made our 3 day stay at the hotel outstanding. Room was incredible, clean, bed was luxurious. Couldn't have been any better. The location was perfect, again, couldn't have been any better. We had such a great time our entire weekend and it was largely due to the hotel and staff. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else next time we go to Chicago. The only thing I would suggest, the fitness room need a radio. Fitness room was fantastic otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for a Girls' Shopping Trip”
Reviews.Author: susankmcg
Reviews.Content: This small, quaint and quiet hotel is located directly behind the Hancock Building - which is a perfect. location for a girls shopping weekend. The staff is helpful and friendly. The price is competitive. I will stay there again without question. Our group was sisters and friends. We had a suite for gathering and then additional rooms which were located right next door. The hotel could not have been more accommodating, right down to the iced lemon water in the lobby..

Reviews.Title: “Girls' Weekend Out”
Reviews.Author: tripsavvy82
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello Hotel was an excellent choice for our weekend away. We stayed in one of their Grand Suites and it was beautiful. The hotel was very clean, the staff was attentive, and the hotel was centrally located. We'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and efficient”
Reviews.Author: louloucoffeywebb
Reviews.Content: Everything I wanted in a classy downtown hotel but with a boutique feel. Small enough to be friendly, yet professional enough to serve my business purposes. And my room was heaven! Can't wait to go back....

Reviews.Title: “Alright hotel, but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl43501
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello Hotel for our honeymoon, so we were looking for a high-end hotel. The hotel was nice, but I did not feel comfortable approaching the staff with any questions, etc. seemed unapproachable and slightly rude. The room was nice, the lobby was beautiful, and I didn't even realize there was a restaurant within the hotel until we were walking out after we just checked out! Were were there for 5 days, and I didn't realize there was a restaurant...I found that kind of odd. The one thing I remember the most was an overpowering smell of perfume/air freshner throughout the building! Overall, the hotel was OK, but I wouldn't stay there again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: ret029
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel near Michigan Avenue and ended up choosing the Rafaello because of its location and great price. Honestly, I didn't know what to expect as far as quality as I was paying much less that what many other hotels in the area were asking for. But I have to say that I was very impressed. As far as location, it can't get any better, being just steps away from the many shops and restaurants on Michigan Avenue. I arrived early and was allowed to check in right away. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The rooms are maybe a little smaller than what some people may be used to, but I found it to be more than adequate as far as size and very clean, cozy and comfortable. Room service was prompt. Really couldn't ask for more in a hotel. Will definitely stay there when I visit again and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique in the heart of Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: mamachiro
Reviews.Content: What a great find in the city! Recently stayed overnight with husband for his birthday. We both work in the city late and had dinner reservations nearby, so I was looking for a boutique style hotel to stay overnight to avoid the late commute back to the burbs. First, the location is great, especially if your new to the city (walking distance from shopping, Navy Pier, boat tours, etc). Second, the hotel lobby is not huge (which doesn't really bother me whatsoever) and very clean. The front desk was very friendly and upgraded us to a junior suite without request! I thought that was a very classy move. The room was more than we needed, but you'll find no argument here. We didn't use the office, mini-bar, or any other room amenities, but all in all were very nice and well kept. The bedroom was large and the bed was uber comfortable (we almost didn't wake up the next morning!). The bathroom is big enough for one person, but it's a boutique hotel, so expect things to be a little smaller. Overall, had a wonderful experience. Sometimes big things come in small packages, and Raffaello hotel is just that!

Reviews.Title: “AS DESCRIBED AND EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: in_the_know044
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing the mixed reviews and even contacted the hotel before our arrival following these reviews. Jared took great care of us, and the entire staff was friendly and efficient. This is a small (boutique) hotel and travelers should be aware of what they are booking. personally I prefer these small hotels, but it means that not all rooms are the same, and some other amenities might be different or not as "flawless" as in the big chains, but this is the same for all small hotels (besides the most expensive ones). the room was clean, several packages that were delivered to me during my stay arrived without any problems (including an ipad which they held onto!) and a problem with the toilette was fixed immediately. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great: price, location, rooms, value.”
Reviews.Author: misterajs
Reviews.Content: I woild definitely return any time I go to Chicago. The price value. Ratio is great . Nice rooms and service, close to e verything, yet very relaxed, private and low key. Very european in feel. Great showers.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: Jenn45042
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay just north of the mag mile to avoid all the bustle. The hotel was extremely clean, we had a very spacious suite, my conference was a 20-minute walk each morning - perfect exercise to begin the day. We were s stone's throw from the Hancock Center and convenient to many great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Photo131
Reviews.Content: We had a good time and every facility we were looking for. It was a bit above our budget, but worth it for a comfortable stay, especially as we were upgraded and had a suite for the weekend. Parking is expensive, but convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and location”
Reviews.Author: gsto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during a business trip in October, 2010. I picked it due to the location (downtown right off Michigan Avenue) and the reasonable room rate. It's an older, smaller hotel but nonetheless clean and elegant. I had no hesitation in meeting my colleague in the lobby. It's a very presentable property. The room was on the smaller side, but well laid out and clean and certainly had enough space for the amount of time I spent in it. Bathroom has obviously been remodeled recently and was definitely a cut above my expectations. My one negative is that the windows appear to be older and not well insulated. The noise from the street was constant - which wasn't a problem when things were bustling and it was constant background noise but at 3 or 4 am the occasional truck passing below led to a fitful night of sleep. Overall an excellent hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again - either on business or a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Raffaello - a wonderful "boutique hotel" !”
Reviews.Author: stjusvi
Reviews.Content: So many diverse opinions on this wonderful little boutique hotel located just off Michigan Avenue with easy access to shops and restaurants. Having spent four nights @ The Raffaello, I feel confidant that those who "nixxed" the small, intimate hotel on this site simply have unrealitistic expectations for "Boutique Hotelsl". SImlply put, boutique hotels, being inately small, do not necessarily offer all of the facilities and services that one might find at larger hotels; however, for myself , this hotel was absolutely perfect! Far away from the "maddening crowds", boutique hotels such as the Rafaello offer the guest a totally different, but unique experience. The check-in processs was seamless ... and while I would admit the elevator may be small, it serves the purpose well. The hotel itself provides the services of a knowledgeable concierge and a small bar, both of which are available at times when needed the most. And for those who need cocktails before 5pm, there are many options in the surrounding neighborhood.. The rooms are beautifully appointed rooms,and include microwave and refrigerators. And, unlike many renovated older buildings, the Raffaelo actually has indiviual thermostat controlled accommodations, a most welcome option in the 70+ weather! . Bathrooms are on the small side but the rain shower is luxurious. Really? Does anyone really need a huge bathroom? All in all , we loved our stay @ the Raffaello .... small, intimate, personal service oriented all describe this little boutique hotel so very well. But, if you want ... mass market, crowds, long lines, a multitude of restaurants and chaos... then book somewhere else! But, if you do decide on the Raffaello, I don't believe you will be disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Anders_L_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October. Nice and clean hotel. Everything within walking distance. Good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Otown10
Reviews.Content: This has been the WORST experince at a hotel ever. Haven't had air conditioning for 2 days and it's upwards of 80 degrees. Customer service is awful and completely incapable of handling any situation. I strongly advise you NOT to stay here. Rooms are dated and the the bathroom feels like a public restroom. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!! Can't wait to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating staff and an overall phenomenal experience”
Reviews.Author: NorthSideBlue
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Raffaello and we couldn't have been more impressed. The staff was extremely helpful, the room was amazing, and everything exceeded our expectations. We had nothing but positive things to say about our stay and recommend it to anyone we talk to. The lobby is very nice, the hotel staff was very courteous and accomodating, and the room was perfect. We stayed in the deluxe suite and it was very clean, the bathroom was gorgeous, and the furniture and bed were VERY comfortable. We're looking forward to our next stay at the Rafaello and I'm telling you, you won't be disappointed with your experience...

Reviews.Title: “I will visit over and over!”
Reviews.Author: DLacallade
Reviews.Content: I visit Chicago monthly and have stayed in several hotels. The Raffaello is a lovely hotel that perfectly balances period charm and fantastic modern updates. The staff is warm and helpful. I will stay at the Raffaello over and over!

Reviews.Title: “POOR SERVICE, NOT A RECOMENDED DESTINATION”
Reviews.Author: bminnis
Reviews.Content: I attempted to schedule a romantic Chicago stay for my wife and I for our wedding anniversary. I booked my reservation online and called the Rafaello direct to explain to them the reason for my stay. I was told they would place a note in my file and they would try to get us into a good room. Upon arrival, we were sent into a room that was equivilent to the size of a closet. In comparing our room to the others on our floor (based on the fire escape drawing), we were by far placed in the smallest room on the floor. In approaching the front desk with my concerns, all I received was a "sorry." What was more upsetting is that we had friend's staying at the hotel that night also whose room was nearly twice the size of ours.....and they paid the same room rate!! Another frustrating item was that the hotel wanted to charge additional money to access the internet wi-fi from your room. Poor service, the unwillingness to address the issue, and the inability to provide any resolution makes me not recomend this hotel for any type of stay.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID at ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: I got a terrible rate but didn't mind at first, because the hotel looked decent. There was HAIR in my bathroom when i arrived. I called the front desk and they came up to clean it - but they missed the hair?!!!! WTF? They didn't offer to bring my bags up or even hold the door. Just avoid this place, please.

Reviews.Title: “OH SO BORING”
Reviews.Author: Equerryman
Reviews.Content: I travel the world - and I've spent more than my fair share of time in hotels that are imminently forgettable - and alas, much to my disappointment, this is one of them. It is true: this hotel is really well located - if you're a big shopper and/or want to take the elevator to the top of the Hancock Building next door. And yes: there is a really good (as in tasty and reasonably priced) Italian restaurant (one of a chain) at the corner - that serves a great linguini with spinach and cold burrara. But the hotel? Bored with itself. The building is old and the rooms reflect its age - i.e., small. The beds are well appointed and the bathroom was classic Italian: all style and dysfunctional (the shower would never turn off fully; the toilet ran hot water!) The lobby has no energy; the staff are sullen and bored. Not a smile in the crowd. They couldn't be bothered to lift a finger or offer a warm greeting (and I was with a remarkably beautiful woman). What's a traveler to do? Find somewhere else to stay that has energy and verve and a better "sense" of itself. To be blunt (and I've seen this many times) this hotel is not owned/managed by a caring person. Let it lapse into receivership and be reborn as something magnificent. Until then stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: bestthings
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Raffaello was at the end of a cross country trip, prior to flying home to the Boston area. We found the Raffaello experience to be an excellent one, rating it best of all our accomodations during the trip, inlcuding San Francisco and Seattle. All aspects of our stay, as indicated in the ratings above, were more than satisfactory. We had one downer, which was of my making, but was superbly handled by the hotel staff - I left valuable jewelry in the room safe and did not discover that until unpacking at home. My call to the night desk clerk was handled very professionally. I was able to speak directly to the staff member who went to the still unoccupied room, retrieved the jewelry and secured it for the night. The next morning the manager and I worked out how I would get my jewelry back. It was returned in its entirety!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, cooking and perfect position will pull me back!”
Reviews.Author: MythicalBeast
Reviews.Content: Raffaello is superbly placed for sightseeing and the waterfront. Staff friendly and helpful with one exception - had to ask twice for shower repair but the second time the response was immediate. Free morning coffee makes up for room-service-only limited breakfast but there is an excellewnt cafe just across the street. The Italian restaurant on the ground floor is first class, with great wine list. Room was comfortable, clean and well cared for - no bathrobe provided. Fun people watching in the high lobby. Can just see the lake from the rooof terrace. Valet parking service was prompt and friendly. Much more personal than a large chain hotel and we would certainly stay here again when we next visit the windy cityy.,

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: katedahl
Reviews.Content: I shared a double double at the Raffaello with a friend when we visited Chicago for a wedding. I've been to Chicago many times and have stayed at other hotels in the area. We had a group rate, so it was a great value for what we paid. Our room was spacious, and the bathroom was large (it appeared to be a handicap bathroom). Having a refrigerator and microwave in the room is always a plus. The only problem we encountered is that there is no vent in the bathroom, so the room would fill with steam with taking a shower and could not escape. If I were traveling alone, this wouldn't have been an issue because I would have just left the door opened while showering, but I didn't want to do this while my friend was getting ready in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Did the research, this is the best!”
Reviews.Author: srichmond2008
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my teenage daughter for a short trip to Chicago before school started. I did a lot of research and talked to people that are from the Chicago area. I checked all the websites, pictures and reviews and booked at Raffaello. My hard work paid off! It was significantly less expensive when I booked it online compared to the other hotels within a mile. The entire hotel is smoke-free which I really like. The room was clean and the service was awesome. I called several times to the front desk with questions and they quickly responded to my requests. The actual building is old but they entirely remodeled it so it has all things new again but the charm of an older hotel like plaster walls, crown molding, and THICK walls. I didn't hear anything outside of our room and slept better there than at home with the comfy beds! I rarely have a good night sleep at a hotel the first night but here I did. The room was a nice size, clean, friendly staff, the location is perfect. We had a great time walking The Magnificent Mile, you are only 1 block away and will not need a cab. We also saw "Blue Man Group". We wanted to go to Navy Pier but were exhausted from shopping so got some take-out and relaxed in the room instead. It was a great time and no issues. I would have liked to stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: rinkrat
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our experience at this hotel. When checking in, there were two people in front of me.....the first was extremely rude, demanding his car immediately be brought up and the second was simply checking in~~ but strangley rude. Never saying thank you or anything just grabbed her keys and stormed off. Despite all this, the lady that checked us in was extremely pleasant. I found all staff extremely pleasant and accomodating. We enjoyed the chilled cucumber water and hot coffee in the lobby We arrived at around 9:00 and our room was not yet ready. (most understandably). We did the paperwork and we ventured out for the day. They indicated they would call us when our room was ready ~~ but we never heard from anyone. When we returned our room was ready. I booked a grand suite and found it to be exacty that. Livingroom with TV, pullout sofa and wetbar with fridge and micro. Bedroom had the most amazing bed and pillows, tv, vanity area, bathroom had huge shower, but somewhat small room. (expected in older hotels). We didn't find it at all inconvenient. Great bath products. Can't say enough about amazing staff. I ran into a "repair man" and told him of a small problem in room and he was there within minutes to fix it. Bell staff was also always pleasant and helpful. Enjoyed rooftop patio. There was a small market across the street from the hotel. (cross the street and walk down steps) They have everything you may want for snacks, wine, rum, vodka, milk, juice etc.....but although they were very pleasant...they were also very overpriced. Around the corrner was a market called Potash.....not spelled correctly ...had a much bigger selection & much better prices. (they had beer, wine, rum, vodka, ect..along with grocery items) It is a walkable distance.....if you don't buy too much) We were also withing walking distance to the trolley. Great tour guides would highly reccommend. Tour guide Lance was the best and Rosetta was fun also. We walked to Ruth Chris, Mike Ditkas, Harry Carry, Billy Goat Tavern and Geno's East Pizza...tons more restaurants withing walking distance ~ those are just the ones we visited. I was concerned about some off the negative reviews ~~ but we have only great things to say, We have stayed in 4, 5 and 6 star hotels ......we were very pleased (especially for what we paid for stay) The business center allowed you to print free boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to 4 star standards - pick someplace else”
Reviews.Author: Beachguy321
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed by a 4 day stay here. Quite simply, this hotel doesn't come close to 4 star standards. I have stayed at dozens of 4 and 5 star hotels, and even 3 star hotels, and I'm not sure this one even merits 3 stars. And I'm not the type that nags after every trip, on the contrary I usually am quite happy. The issues we faced: - Bad water pressure in the shower. Even after they claimed to "fix it". What's worse than a lousy shower on a trip? - Sticky spots on the rug. Really gross. Again, they claimed they sent someone to "take care of it" while we were out. No change. - Lousy elevators. Obviously this place used to be residential at some point, and the 2 small elevators don't cut it. We came and went at all times of day and this was a constant problem. Wait awhile, and then the elevator arrives, completely full. We took the stairs many times. And no, I don't need the exercise. - Internet. I'm sorry, but it's a really cheesy to charge $10 for the internet when you are paying over 300 bucks a night. Especially if it's not even wireless. You might as well charge me for electricity. I know many hotels do this, but the better ones have started to realize travelers can't stand it. To be fair, when I complained, they waived the charge. - Chipped paint on door and in room. Sure, do I really care? But really, if you want to be 4 stars, you need to look like it. - No soap in the room. Until we called housekeeping. Really? All in all, a big disappointment. In the interest of saying something nice, the staff was nice (while pretending to take care of our problems), and the beds were really comfortable. And sure the location is great, but there are a lot of other better places very close by. Don't make the mistake we did and get suckered in by the lower price.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: travelingman59
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, near Hancock Tower, Magnificent Mile and the lake. Room 412 had two double beds and a very large bathroom (but very little shelf space). Hotel staff did a fine job helping us. Fixed balky TV right away. No coffee in rooms, but easily available in very nice lobby. Got a great rate at Jetsetter.com (strictly a limited time offer). Overall very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Raffaello a little jewel box”
Reviews.Author: mimi2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during aug 2, 2010 for 3 nights. Totally loved it. Rooms were on the small side but the character of the hotel made up for this. The location can,t be beat. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Will come back often. Parking costs not too bad. Parked at 247 w chestnut street. $28 night. Did not need car the whole time. Very close to red line train to get to wrigley field. Lots of restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Management Unresponsive and Insensitive to Room problem”
Reviews.Author: Dietrying
Reviews.Content: We checked in to room about 11:30 pm for a 2 night stay. Upon entering the room the temperature was in the mid 90's. The AC was running but just blowing hot air. We called the front desk and asked for another room. Instead they said they would send up an engineer to fix the AC. At 12:30 the engineer arrived at the room. He took a quick look and siad the AC was not fixable that night. He said he would get us a fan. We called the front desk again and said the air temp was unbearable and we needed a different room. They said no rooms were available and they would fix the AC in the morning. We waited till 1:30 am for a fan but the engineer never came back. We were mostly unable to sleep in the room inasmuch the temp approached 95 degrees.When we went to our meeting the next morning we talked to the desk manager who said they would fix the AC and if they couldn't would move us to another room. Upon our return later in the day they told us the AC could not be fixed and they had moved our stuff to another room. We then asked for and adjustment to out bill for the one night. We were told we needed to call Jare Galbut the GM the following week. We called 6 times over the next 2 weeks leaving messages for Mr Galbut. He did not return any of our calls. We asked a desk manager for an adjustment and were told since they moved us to another room that that was sufficient to solve our problem and that they would not issue a credit.

Reviews.Title: “Severely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dhumm
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 4-Start Hotel!!! Other than the location, this dingy dank location offers nothing. Desperately in need of a deep cleansing and paint job. Next time will go with the full servie chain hotel sthat also share this prime locale. We actually tried to check out mid-stay but due to cancellation policy were stuck. Horrible

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: trvljunkie79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a girls' weekend to Chicago for shopping and sightseeing. The location was ideal, it is next to the John Hancock building, one block from Michigan Ave shopping and a few blocks from Lake Michigan. The hotel has a boutique feel with modern decor and a cozy atmosphere. Our room (302) was clean, spacious, well-decorated and had a view of the John Hancock building. We were pleased to find both a fridge and microwave in the room. A bonus feature of the hotel is the rooftop terrace. My only complaints are that there was no clock radio in our room, no free WiFi ($9.95/24 hours) and no iPod dock, but that's just being picky.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it ... again”
Reviews.Author: ToonTownFarmer
Reviews.Content: We prefer more boutique hotels and this place is great! Stayed for 4 days again this past week. It compares nicely to other places in San Fran and New York. If you are going to stay, we would suggest the Grand Suites - cant beat it for $250ish a night taxes in. Not sure of the other rooms, never been in one of those. The front staff could use a customer service course but I found the firmer you are about anything, the better the results. I phoned direct to the reservations manager after finding a better deal online than their online price and got the great deal - the other satff on the phone have no power. The door guys are top notch on providing info and advice - even though we knew what we wanted we still ask. The concierge are a waste of time - they look like they would rather google around the net than help. The only frustration was no free wifi - just a 24 hours package for $10. We just stopped at Borders down the block to update. You cant beat the location for shopping - most of the places are within a 10 min walk. Great for the Navy Pier too - we walked but it would be a cheap cab ride. The tour buses depart a block away - we never had time to do it but heard great things from others in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Putey
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night at the Raffaello and enjoyed this small hotel. The doormen and hotel clerks are very nice and helpful. We loved going up to the lovely rooftop and enjoying the city views and some wine. Close to the lakefront and Michigan Ave shopping.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCACION”
Reviews.Author: jshay422
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay in downtown Chicago for my nephew's graduation trip. Though I am familiar with Chicago, this little gem had not been on my radar until I found a great deal through travelape.com. It was half the price of the other hotels in the neighborhood, but the quality was twice as good! The staff was excellent, very helpful and friendly. We enjoyed sitting on the rooftop patio (which had a nice view of the lake on the north side) in the mornings and evenings. It is an older hotel without some of the more modern amenities, but it was clean and our room was beautiful. It also was spacious enough for the four of us, had a mini bar (though we didn't use it) and refrigerator space for our personal items. The hotel is located close to shopping and restaurants and is central to the CTA busses and trains, so we were easily able to get to all the sites in the city. Parking was also reasonable at the garage across the street. They even won over my father who hates staying in the city. We will definitely be staying there again on our next trip to the Windy City!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: viajeramx1
Reviews.Content: My experience with a suite was very good. Location is great, just two blocks from Michigan avenue and some blocks away from Oak St beach. Price is convenient. Room is clean.Decoration is very nice. I would like coffe makers in the room. It lacks elevators and looby staff. Concierge was not very helpful with directions, he just told me what he found in ggogle and did not make an effort to find another solution. It is my second stay, two weeks each and I have been very comfortable in the hotel. Wi fi internet is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Why I will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: asimays
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had reservations at this hotel this past weekend while visiting Chicago. We had booked it 2 months in advanced and had already paid for our room in full. When we got to the hotel we were told we needed to wait as the manager wanted to see us. We waited about 10 minutes and were finally told that the manager couldn't make it but that they didn't have a room for us after all because they were overbooked. We demanded to see the manager who while was apologetic, she had no explanation as to why this happened and was clearly not in a position to do anything about it. The "best they could do" was book us in a hotel out in O'Hare and give us $50 in cash for a taxi (which they upped to $100 when we balked). The hotel in O'Hare was gross and empty (the front desk clerk explained they had been trying to get a computer for their guests to use for a year now) and nothing of what we had been looking for. We also had to rearrange our plans for the weekend as we already had dinner reservations and events scheduled in the city where we expected to be all weekend! I will never stay at a property owned by this company again and I hope to influence others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: aliecakes
Reviews.Content: I live at the Trump here in Chicago. Whenever I have work done to my home I stay in a different hotel try to get to know the area. I must say there web designer is a genius. He made lemonade out of a lemon. I have NEVER been more disappointed. How they got 4 stars is either a lie or a mistake. Service was HORRIBLE!! The bellman doing absoluteIy nothing did not help me with my luggage at all. Thank god my cab driver was nice enough to get it to the door for me. I ended up carrying it myself. had a very important envelope that came to the front desk. They failed to even tell me it came...Thank God I live close so I could pick it up. Apparently the evening operator was in extremely rude to my husband when he called. Despite have the "Do Not Disturb" sign in the key lock it did not stop the cleaning staff from knocking on the door 4 times. The mini bar was not stocked. The manager was awful. The manager was rude and dismissive. I spoke with the manager about my "experience". She just blew it off kind of rolled her eyes, she only seemed genuinely concerned when I informed her that i would be making several complaints. Then she was all ears, but I was done talking at that point. Room service is DISGUSTING and OVER PRICED!! I will spend a lot of money for good food, a fortune for great food ;) I would have rather eaten at McDonald's, and I am not a fan of theirs. I have twin boys, so we ordered a lot of room service. They got orders wrong, over cooked or under cooked almost everything. The bread was soggy on the sandwiches, a $28 plate of chicken had the texture of rubbery boiled chicken with those fake sear marks with a jar gravy. The plates were inconsistent. The best thing I found on the menu was the fruit plate. Sometimes it came with a grapefruit sometimes it didn't. The potato side with the lamb had almost paste like mashed potatoes with it the next time a chopped up potato gravy spoon molded mess. You get the picture. Ahhhh, and this part just makes me laugh. On an EXTREMELY limited menu. I reluctantly settled on bacon and eggs (comes with a side of unseasoned red potatoes). No condiments ever come with any meal, so I make sure to request tabasco and ketchup with the meal. I am informed that since it is a sophisticated italian restaurant, the "chef" refuses to even carry tabasco or ketchup. This is a joke right? Nope, the only joke is the Rafaello itself. The room service server was extremely nice and asked me if I would complain because she gets yelled at all the time and the "hotel" would not do anything. She asked if it would be all right if the "chef" called me. I said I would love to speak with this cook. After i picked at my dried bread or under done toast and the overly fried egg (crusty brown edge and cool middle) I wait for my call that never comes, 3 hours before I left I attempted to call him again and he again did not call back. The hotel is SMALL and CRAMPED. The elevator could barely fit my 3 suitcases in it. Walls are paper thin. I got to hear all of my neighbors come in and out and hear the squeaky cleaning cart. The suite itself was ok, but it had a prison size bathroom and a shower. The shower does not have a door and the bathroom traps in steam. The phone did not work. The movies were limited and the remote had a delay. Really dimly lit. Air condition didn't work properly. I paid for 4 nights, got fed up and left after 3. I decided I would rather smell paint than put up with another night there. Of course there was no night bell captain. So let me sum it up. POSITIVES: Location Shower gel has a nice scent TV is decent Bedding is nice NEGATIVES: Service Food Structure

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: EYtraveller
Reviews.Content: Just spent two days at this hotel. Booked it on Jetsetter for $149 a night. I would have been annoyed if I paid anymore than that for the room. For the money I cant complain. The location is excellent, right next to the Hancock Tower and just off Michigan Avenue ( Mag Mile). The only taxis I took were to and from O'Hare. The room was small and had an overlook of fire escapes ( probably a result of the $149 a night so not important). The front door was hard to close. The refrigerator was poorly placed and kept hitting the door frame of the bathroom when you opened it, it was annoying. The bed was comfortable and pillows were fine. Unfortunately, something in the wall near the A/C vent kept rattling and woke me up both mornings. I had to hit the wall to make it stop. Sure this was not in every room but all I cared was it was in MY room. The bathroom was small and modern. Good water pressure in the shower. NO BATH TUB. The shower had one of those glass dividers that only goes half way across the shower. Looks cool and trendy, but lets water get all over and it did. Bathroom did not have glasses or little storage space for toiletries. The people at the front desk were very polite and helpful. There is nothing to complain about the staff, they were excellent. I did not eat at the restaurant, they gym was small. It had some treadmills and ellipticals which is fine if you just want to run. Dumbells go up to 50lbs. Gym had TVs and water bottle. Internet is $9.95 for 24 hours in the room. In the business center the computer is $6.95 for 15 minutes of use. Like I said, for the price it was fine, I was only in the room to sleep, but next time I will stay at the Ritz Carlton, Peninsula or Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Uninformed staff.”
Reviews.Author: Tuxmiller
Reviews.Content: Right next to John Hancock building and a block from Michigan Ave. Great location. Quick check-in but staff was inaccessible, ignorant of basic hotel information (like do you have hot tea available) and unhelpful with even the basics. You have to pay for wi-fi access. Parking is $49 for 24 hours. Great rooftop area.

Reviews.Title: “You could do worse, but also MUCH BETTER.”
Reviews.Author: DallasNFL
Reviews.Content: It was not a bad hotel, but I will not ever stay again. I believed the other reviews, and took a chance. Though people may have mentioned some good things, there were so many small things that were not good, they all added up. They list a dvd player in each room. When we were put on hold about the missing player, the recording they play as you wait, boasted about the dvd players in each room. We were told the owners got rid of them. They also got rid of the coffee pots! There are no raised floor bottoms on the shower, so an extra drain is in front of the toilet, for the water. Water flows freely all over the bathroom floor under the shower curtain. The tv was on the far right of the room, though the 2 beds are in the middle. Tv was in a little cubby area, not good for viewing. The fridge was so small, it only has enough room for the mini-bar items. If you want to use it, you have to remove all the pay stuff, and have the bar items take up nearly all of the limited counter space. Elevators barely held 2 people and our luggage. No joke. 4 person max, and no room for luggage with 4! Hot elevator temp. Smallest Lobby I have ever seen. About the size of my Great room and kitchen. The main lobby being a great room, and the coffee area like my kitchen.. Air conditioning in the lobby and halls were none, or limited. Concierge never answered my emails sent 5 days before my trip. Location was good, but there are better at this price. Rooms were clean, bedding was great. Robes were shown in photos. No robes. No vending machines of any kind. Lobby offers free coffee and water. Ice only on every other floor. Staff was friendly. We had to change rooms. 1st room had a garbage dumpster outside our window, and was old, odd shaped, and poorly arranged.. Second room had a nicer view, and was newer. 2nd room also had better tv placement. TVs were flat screen, HD. The channels however, were not HD, so we had to adjust the screen width so we did not have to watch everything stretched. All rooms are not equal. Old room had a huge bathroom, huge like a locker room. Very odd.. Nicer 2nd room had a tiny tiny bathroom, but it did have a ledge to stop the water. It only had a Â½ shower door though.. No soap dish in the showers. No hook or ring for a hand towel. No cup in the bathroom. Both bathrooms had an odd placement for the bath towels. Right above the toilet paper. Unless you folded your towels in Â½, they covered the toilet paper. Carpet was like kitchen carpet, flat and a little stained, though clean.2 rocks glasses at the bar, but no cup to brush your teeth. Bathroom scale and remote both needed new batteries. Maids were quiet and courteous. Other guests were also quiet and courteous. One thing I will list as a deal breaker though, was the air conditioning. In both of our rooms, the air was a dial thermostat. (a dial like an .am radio) the air in both rooms was set at 50 degrees. This is the lowest setting. My guess was it was around 73 to 75 degrees in the room, with no way to go lower. Not horribly hot, but never refreshingly cool by any measure. They claimed the 2nd room had updated or recently cleaned air vents, filters, etc..but it was the same. There is no reason whatsoever to choose this hotel over any other. I hope my words have a ring of truth, as I tried to mention good as well as not so good. Not bad, just not good. The 10 dollar a day internet is really too much. Many Chicago hotels are free internet, and the ones who charge range from 4-6 dollars. Also, you have to get a code every 24 hours for the internet. We take a trip to Chicago every year, for the past 9 or 10 yrs. Different hotel every time. This is my 1st review of any Chicago downtown hotel . Iâ€™d never been disappointed before. Weâ€™ve never stayed at the Hyatt, or Hilton. We always stay at Mid-priced chains. Our 1st so-called Boutique, and our last.

Reviews.Title: “best deal for the dollar for girls getaway”
Reviews.Author: nomadsister
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 1701 and hosted a light dinner for a bacehlorette party before hitting the clubs which were a $5 or less cab ride or a 10 to 15 min. Walk. Mi. Ave shopping half a block down. There were 9 of us and 5 slept overnight. King bed, fold out queen size that slept 2 adults quite comfortably and get this...a murphy bed that slept one! The kitchenette had no sink, which was a surprise and no coffee maker, but complimentary organic coffee was downstairs and very good. Perfect place to host a small group. Again we had 9. There was a good size round glass table to seat 4 and a coffee table too. I surprised the bride with a champagne toast on the rooftop patio. If you veer off to the right of the patio, there is anarrow walkway that leads you to a lake view! Used a AAA discount for this grand exec. Suite and got it for 296 before tax. 341 after. Keep in mind. This hotel is old and some of it may show, and yes I agree w others about service. No warm fuzzy feeling here. The nicest people were from housekeeping. Least fuzzy were bell service. Nothing to keep me from going back. Overall definitely worth the money...

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to love this place.”
Reviews.Author: rcote75
Reviews.Content: I booked my room on Jetsetter. The hotel location is amazing and I really liked my room, although it was a bit small, it was nicely done. I loved the minibar, the micro and fridge. The room had everything I needed...except air conditioning. After more than 24 hours of calling and going to the front desk I found out that it's just that room. It's near a heating unit and just doesn't get cool. Since it was over 90 degrees outside I really needed air conditioning. As it was, I was sweating after my shower getting ready for dinner. The front desk clerk told us she was "too busy" to deal with us. I find that completely unacceptable. We were finally rushed out of our room and moved to a handicap room on a lower floor. Granted the room was bigger and the air conditioning worked, but it was too little too late at that point. There was a lot about this hotel I liked, but I didn't enjoy the attitude from the staff. This was my vacation, which I paid good money and worked hard to be on. A friendlier staff would have made a lot of this better.

Reviews.Title: “Supurb location & nice hotel but expensive & staff not too friendly”
Reviews.Author: KABDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a colleague on the back of a business trip to the States mid June. On first impressions I thought the hotel was going to be great. The location is really all you could ask for. Just a two minute walk to the lake front & literally one block away from all the main shopping areas! However, upon checking in we were aware that the staff just were not very friendly or all that helpful. It felt awkward when asking them more than just one or two questions, which was inevitable given the limited amount of info we had (re: brekfast, internet, directions, taxi service etc.). It was also dissappointing that breakfast was not included in the room price - which was not cheap! However, the room was nice enough & very comfortable. The bathroom was small though & the toilet didnt flush properly. Overall, I think it's a good enough hotel & if you book earlier in advance than we did perhaps you would get a better price & thus feel you got better value for money. You really cannot beat the location though & what a fabulous city Chicago is!

Reviews.Title: “Raffaello Hotel - Superb Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Indian_Baldie
Reviews.Content: This was the first stay for my wife and I at the Raffaello and we were extremely pleased. The hotel is located one block or so east of the John Hancock building on Delaware St. Michigan avenue and all the shops, etc. are within walking distance. The location cannot be beat! The room was larger than I had expected and was very clean and comfortable. This hotel is ideal for a long weekend (or short weekend) stay in Chicago. There is nothing negative I can write about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “terrific find!”
Reviews.Author: slw05e
Reviews.Content: Recently my friends and I stayed at the Raffaello and were thoroughly impressed. The hotel was walking distance from the main shopping areas and the lake as well. The front desk was extremely helpful in reccommending places to eat and visit. The hotel itself was exquisite with a perfect blend of historic architecture and modern design. The room was spacious and had an ipod dock, large flatscreen, microwave and minifridge which were all great touches. I highly reccommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Chicago-area!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PaulQuinn
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello is a great hotel, it is hard to find a negative to be honest. The hotel is situated one block away from Michigan avenue, and about three blocks from the shore. The hotel itself is welcoming and very modern. The rooms, are quite small, but you wouldnt expect a massive room in a big city, however given that they provide everything you want them too. The bed is very comfortable and the room provides internet access. I didnt use the gym at the hotel, however I would advise going for a run along the shore, which is beautiful, and the hotel is only three blocks from there. The only downfall is that the hotel doesnt have a breakfast restaurant. You can order breakfast via room service. However, opposite the hotel there is a cafe which is part of the hilton hotel which offers a fantastic buffet breakfast for $16, catering for all types. It does a fantastic selection of fruit and oatmeal. All in all, very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: RazorlightManchester
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Raffaello hotel for a week at the end of April 2010. Chicago is a wonderful city to visit, it is very similar to New York but with a bit more subtlety and charm, it is like NYC with the volume turned down ! I had heard good things about Chicago and would recommend it to anyone who wanted high standard shops, things to do and friendly locals. I arrived into Chicago O'Hare and got the blue CTA line into the city, changed lines at Jackson and got the Red Line north to Chicago - which is two blocks west of the Raffaello Hotel which is in East Delaware St, it's a 5-10 min walk to the hotel. I was impressed with the size of my suite, which was on the second floor. The hotel is ideally situated for shopping, it's 5 mins from the Water Tower area, and Michigan Avenue "Magnificent Mile" - I have to say the shops are every bit as good as anywhere you are likely to visit, all the big brand names have shops in the area, as well as Macy's and Bloomingdales - which are wonderful shops on their own. I spent my week visiting all the sites, I did a tour of the Cubs ground - Wrigley Field, Sears Tower Skydeck 103 flrs up, I did a 90 min boat tour on the lake/river with Wandella tours - which was $ 25 and booked at their key down at the South end of the Magnificent mile, I also visited the Field History Museum, and Second City comedy club. All in all I'd totally recommend a visit to Second city - if comedy is your thing you shouldn't miss this as it was a really good evening for a $ 22 ticket. I'd also recommend taking a walk round Millenium park which is really peaceful and likewise the lakeside path which you can reach from an underpass near the Raffaello hotel, it's a nice way to spend some time walking along the lake.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: arsini29
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Raffaello and will not be our last. This is a Fantastic hotel. There was an initial wait while we tried to check in, but the staff gave us a room upgrade (King room to deluxe) due to the wait. The deluxe room was perfect and exactly what we needed, instead of the usual one room this gave us some separation (perfect). The room was very clean and beds are extremely comfortable. We had the best night of sleep we've ever had in our numerous stays in Chicago hotels. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. The gentleman serving as concierge helped with advice and dinner reservations, very helpful and pleasant. I don't recall an area in the hotel that sold drinks and/or snacks, but considering the location it was not a problem to find those items. We did have a mini bar, but as a rule of thumb I don't use them. In a nutshell the Raffaello has great rooms, staff and the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, great room, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: mrstravel08
Reviews.Content: We booked the deluxe suite and upon arrival we were upgraded to the executive suite! We got in around 7 pm and all of the deluxe suites were taken so we were bumped to a better room at no extra charge! The staff was very attentive bringing us extra towels, making sure our luggage was taken care of, my husband even lost some things out of his wallet and when we returned back to our room we found them under the door in an envolope. Oh and the beds were very comfortable and clean. There is a restaurant in the hotel however we didn't eat there. We had a great stay and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: klawrence925
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant when reading some of the reviews. But once we arrived I was pleasantly surprised. Liz who worked at the front desk was the best. We were booked for a suite but she was able to give us an upgrade to the Executive Grand Suite. She was so accommodating. We would recommend this hotel to all of our friends

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel- enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: hersheykiss17
Reviews.Content: This wasn't my favorite hotel that i ever stayed at, but it was very nice and acceptable. we traveled to chicago for the weekend and raffaello was very close to the michigan ave shopping area. nice location. the only downfall was the concierge . they were pretty nonexistent and it wasn't like a 5star chain that accommodates your every desire. it was a GREAT value- definitely worth the money and a solid choice. pull out couch was really uncomfortable so if you stay with extra guests than the amount that the beds can hold, watch out!

Reviews.Title: “4star???? Paper Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: lesh4537
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was shocked at how small the lobby was. I also was disppointed because on the web-site of the hotel it stated that there was a restaurant in the hotel. When we arrived I found no such thing. We booked a double double and from the pictures it looked as though it was a decent size. When we got to the room it was smaller than expected. The toliet didn't work and the sink drain did not drain properly (the toliet was fixed in a timely manner). The staff was nice (except the front desk person upon arrival). We went to Cafe Med across the street for our spirits, the staff was extremely nice! In a nut shell I would not stay at this hotel again, was not pleased with the rooms or hotel itself, the renovation I think makes it a 4 star but I would have to rate it a 3 star. NOT TO MENTION THE PAPER THIN WALLS! We "spoken" to for complaints when we were talking in our room at 4am (not at a loud or partying tone at all, normal, indoor voices)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: SimoneK519
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Raffeallo and when I checked out I left behind two dresses. I checked out at 2 o'clock and at realized at 4 when I was unpacking that I had left the dresses behind and called the front desk. After leaving a message with housekeeping, I decided to go there myself to talk to someone in person. The manager at the front desk informed me that no one had checked into my room since I had left and told me that housekeeping did not find the dresses. I talked to the manager on duty and the conceirge for the hotel and both said that since I left it behind there was nothing they could do. They did not offer any type of assistance further than checking the room and no compensation for the two dresses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, won't visit it again though”
Reviews.Author: SugaTn
Reviews.Content: What I look for in a hotel room is comfort but I didn't find that here. The Rafaello is quite small and old to me. The service received was great, very friendly staff, but it stops there.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the price”
Reviews.Author: hockeguy55
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I travelled to Chicago for a night together in April. We wanted something affordable but nice-- didn't want to stay in a dive. We were certainly satisfied with our experience. We booked a standard room for $105 a night on a Friday night, which was incredibly cheap compared to the other options in the neighborhood. When we got there the staff was very friendly and immediately upgraded us from a standard room to a deluxe suite for free. The room was big yet cozy, and the bed was very comfortable-- I had a great night's sleep. The bathroom was also very nice, albeit a bit small, but very nicely decorated and impressive. The room had a small mini bar and mini fridge with microwave, which was a nice touch. The only down side that I could find is that the walls seemed as though they may be a bit thin. I was not personally disturbed by any noise during my stay, but when someone was out in the hallway talking with someone else/on their phone/etc, we could tell. In the end, you can't beat the Raffaello for the price. If you're on somewhat of a budget, I would definitely recommend it. If you have the expendable income and can afford $300+ a night, I'm sure there are nicer hotels in Chicago for that price. But if you want a clean hotel with comfortable rooms and a friendly staff for a romantic getaway, I'd suggest the Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family accomodation in the heart of Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: lysychka
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a Grand Suite which was well sized for 3 adults and 2 kids. The bedding was very comfortable as it was nice to have access to a microwave and the mini fridge bar. The bedroom area was separated from the living room by french doors which was nice for us as we had a baby. We needed a crib as we had an infant. They brought a pack and play and not a real crib. It was too low and too hard for the baby to sleep in, so we had to take her to sleep in our bed, fortunatelly it was a king size bed. Overall, the suite was clean and in good shape, but it does not show a brand new charm. The sofa upholstery and carpet are getting to be a bit worn out.There is a small roof patio which may be a good place to hang out on during warm months. The lobby is small and you will not be able to hang out there. There is a small grocery store in the basement of the condo building across the street. Location is perfect for exploring Magnificient Mile with a family. It is close to the playground near Modern Art Museum, close to the Water Tower Place mall. Cheesecake Factory restaurant is 5 minutes away. American Girl store is very close. Hershey's store was a big hit with our older child. The 900 N Michigan Avenue mall houses Frankie's 5th Floor Pizeria which was a good and tasty choice for our family. The Rush Street had a good selection of bars for adults. The front desk people were always nice. The only bad thing was that we were charged for the minibar item that we have not used. The accounting does not answer voice mail, so it was a bit frustrating to deal with them. Eventually, they have removed the charge. Overall, It is a solid choice for exploring Chicago with a family.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: operagirl79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I had expected. The lobby and building is gorgeous, it's a historic building and they really preserved all the beautiful moldings, marble, and structure. We were able to check in at 11am instead of waiting until 3, our room was chic and the bathroom was big enough to play softball in. The room has robes in the closet, a nice flat screen and fridge and microwave. So convenient! The location of course is amazing, steps from the John Hancock and Water Tower place. The bellhops and staff went out of their way to greet, hold doors and help you with luggage. Our travel companions got there after us and couldn't check in as early as we did due to rooms being cleaned, so they held their baggage for them until around 2pm. We got our room for under $100 and got free coupons to Bloomies and Macy's just for staying. However, the parking is the best part - only $23 a night at the garage across the street, good until 4pm the day of checkout! What a STEAL.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: nikaroo
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 4 nights in September and we loved it. We booked it at a discounted price on Expedia.com and were very happy. The room and bathroom were clean and roomy and the location was fantastic!! Walking distance to El stations, the Magnificent Mile, and the John Hancock Observatory. We would definitely stay here again if we were back in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Location is what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: lownielass
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Thanksgiving, at a reduced rate, but would be disappointed to pay full price. The first impression upon walking in the lobby is that there is so much potpurri, that they must be hiding a bad smell. The room(a jr. suite) was roomy, but gloomy. There was obviously a water problem from above as all of the paint/wallpaper was chipping or peeling, and there were large swatches of patching on the ceiling. the bathroom was so small there was no where to put a used towel or a bath kit. We were next to the ice machine that made a pounding noise day and night. "continental" breakfast was available upon request, for a rich price plus 18% and tax. No room service. The location is excellent, 2 blocks from the mag mile and 2 blocks from the lake. The doorman was attentive, but we could not even reach the front desk when we called. This room is available for sale for the nominal price of $450,000, for what is basically an efficiency. The 25 million dollar renovation they brag about appears to have gone into the purchase of flat screens, 2 per room and not the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: caliey
Reviews.Content: Not a very warm feeling when walking into the lobby. Woman behind the small desk didn't smile and seemed put out a bit. Stayed for two nights. We upgraded to a Deluxe King Suite. Rooms were nice and clean. Sofa was very hard and uncomfortable to sit on. Bed was comfortable, BUT the bathroom was the size of a postage stamp. No room for TWO people to put anything. In fact, the toilet was so close to the wall that when I would sit down the toilet paper rubbed my leg (I'm petite size 6). When taking a shower my husband splashed water all over the wall outside the small shower. No tub! We did call down to reception after checking in to see if there was a room with a larger bathroom but was told there were none, that the only ones with larger bathrooms were a big upgrade and those weren't available. Definitely not enough room to have two people in it at the same time! We live outside of Milwaukee and travel to Chicago quite often and have stayed in many of the hotels downtown. We chose the Raffaello because of the big renovation. It is a very old hotel and they did upgrade the rooms quite a bit. We had stayed there back in the mid-80's and there was a lot of improvement since then. It is convenient to the Magnificient Mile but the $400 for two nights was a little much for what we got. Also ate at there new restaurant with a "Michelin star and James Beard Award" chef. Neither of us were impressed by the decor or the meal. It was okay but nothing to write home about. Be aware that the bar (only six seats) is right by the door and everytime it was opened, the cold air swirled in - brrrrr.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: ugacrew
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a quick get away to meet family in Chicago and stayed at the Raffaello because the rates were fantastic and the location couldn't be beat. The rooms are quite large. Included with the room that I stayed in were two double beds. Also there was a coffee maker, refrigerator, and microwave. Although I didn't use any of them it's good knowing they are there for leftovers or storing drinks bought from the Walgreens that's close by. The bed slept very well. They weren't too soft nor to hard. The bedding was more than acceptable. The one drawback that I can also consider a plus is the shower. There is only a partial glass partition that doesn't do a good job of keeping the water from soaking the rest of the bathroom floor. The floor mat is pretty soaked halfway through by the time one person has used the shower.
