You may want to ask the front desk for extra towels the night before so that you'll have them first thing in the morning. Having said that the shower experience it self was wonderful. I'm very inclined to switch my shower head out for the rainfall style that was in my hotel room. It's a great way to unwind from a long day of shopping or being at a conference. There are a couple tips that I'd like to leave. At the time of this review the internet access for a 24 hour time period via wireless (nice and fast) was $9.95. The business center charges $5.95 for 15 minutes of access. I needed to use the center in order to print an important document. The elevators are quite small and there are only two. Patience is a virtue when waiting for one. The gym is free and located on the second floor along with the business center and full service spa. The site says the hotel features L'Occitane products. When I was there they provided me with Gilchrist & Soames products which are just as nice. Parking is quite expensive at $47 a night. I didn't need to park a car since I arrived by train. Overall I would stay here again since the location is great, the rate for the room that I received was very competitive, it has a boutique feel and is rated appropriately.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: casey414
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for a conference at McCormick Place and stayed at the Raffaello with two classmates. We enjoyed our stay here. The room was large, very clean, and relaxing. The doormen would walk down the street in search of a cab for us if there were none close by. We were greeted every time we returned to the hotel with a "Welcome back!" The location is great and is within walking distance of many restaurants and shopping, one block off the Magnificent Mile, next door to the John Hancock building, and a nice walk to the Navy Pier. The staff was very friendly and very helpful, from recomending restaurants to quickly delivering anything requested from housekeeping. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel in Chicago!!!! SERIOUSLY!”
Reviews.Author: rweed7979
Reviews.Content: My classmates and I were absolutely amazed at how beautiful, modern, clean, and AWESOME The Raffaello was from the moment we walked in the front doors!! We loved it!!! The doormen were so hospitable and friendly. The people at the front desk were so nice & always smiling & helpful. I felt important while I was there. This hotel is nothing like your normal chain hotels--it's so much better. It looks like it would cost a fortune to stay there, but it is VERY AFFORDABLE!! I cannot wait to plan my next trip to Chicago, and the only place I ever want to stay in Chicago is The Raffaello!! The location is PERFECT: 1-1/2 blocks from Michigan Ave, and 1 block from Lake Michigan! I absolutely LOVE the Raffaello Hotel!!! Thank you, Raffaello Hotel, for making my stay in Chicago the very best it could be! I couldn't ask for anything better!

Reviews.Title: “Nice European Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaimeMexico
Reviews.Content: Clean and well located. Staff was friendly. Fitness room was excellent for a smallish hotel. I recommend it for business and couples travel. Well priced.

Reviews.Title: “2'nd year in a Row”
Reviews.Author: RobinOntario
Reviews.Content: This was our 2'nd stay at the Raffaello. The location is amazing. Two blocks from Michigan Ave (and the Cheesecake Factory) Maybe four from the American Girl Doll store. Can walk anywhere. Also taxi's are always driving by. I travelled with my husband and two children (ages 8 and 11) We had a large suite which had two rooms separated by a door. It had a king size bed, a pull our couch and also had a parsons bed which was a bonus for the kids. Two flat screen TV's, a mini bar, microwave, and lots of drawers for storage. As the weather was cold we had to use the heat. In the kids room the first night it wouldn't turn on. We called the front desk the next morning and immediately it was fixed. The door men were very very friendly and helpful. Front desk was great as well. I like this hotel because it is a smaller place - very clean, nice modern decor, large rooms. Also, it feels European. One drawback is the bathroom. The shower is set up so that it doesn't close. Only half a pane of glass. Therefore its virtually impossible to contain the water in the shower space. Had to mop up the bathroom floors often. Called down for towels once (as my daughter used too many) housekeeping showed up in less than a minute with a pile of them. Last year the highlight of our visit for me was the soaps and shampoos the hotel privided. L'Occitane. I was in heaven. Too bad they changed that. Nice soaps but can't compare. I would book this place again. Hopefully next year. Oh Almost forgot - the beds were amazing. Sooo comfortable and cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Can I Have A Spoon?”
Reviews.Author: Lick-A-Pringle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Raffaelo for two nights in October. We arrived at 10 a.m. which was too early to check-in so we gave the hostess our phone # and went to a Cubs game. They lost. Surprise. The doormen were very helpful and the hostess was efficient. We even got upgraded to a suite on the 17th floor. The view was of other buildings, but at least the windows opened somewhat. The shower was funky as there wasn't a door, only a half pane of glass. Needless to say I got water all over the bathroom floor. The bed was very comfy! The living area included a mini-fridge, microwave, sink, coffee table, work table and another sitting table area. The mini-fridge has an honor bar with overpriced items. The flat screen TV was way too far away from the couch for nominal viewing. The location was fantastic. You can get to Macy's and H&M within 5 minutes walking. The Navy Pier is also walkable, but plan on a 20 minute stroll along the shore of Lake Michigan. It's a nice, quiet hotel and a great value. One night I stumbled in a little tipsy with my wife with a container of ice cream and realized we forgot spoons. We entered the restaurant after closing and the manager hooked us up with two spoons! Happy night.

Reviews.Title: “tres chic (almost)”
Reviews.Author: Dillicious
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was very nice. Recently renovated, it has a modern feel. I thought it was a bit overpriced because the accomodations and service were not over the top, however, it was in a great location (right next to the John Hancock Tower). We had a king bed suite. Downers: Slow elevator, and the shower did not drain well (which was a problem because it was a step in). Plus: relatively close to the El and areas of interest in the city

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Larry1962
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel and excellent location. We had a suite on the 16th. floor and it was quite spacious and comfortable. The bed was heavenly as were the fluffy pillows. I didn't want to get out of bed every morning! Nice flat screen TV's and workable windows that you can open, which made it nice at night. I'd give it a 5 but there were a few flaws. The front desk staff were a bit stuffy and stiff. Only one robe in our room and no pens or writing paper that we could find. The carpet had burn spots just inside the front door and the bath toiletries were on the tiny size. The soap kept falling through the holder. Overall a nice place. We will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as the website suggests”
Reviews.Author: Gardengro
Reviews.Content: The website showed an upscale hotel with very nice rooms. Our room was very very small. We had to lift our suitcase over the bed because there wasn't enough room to wheel it to a space large enough to open. Sitting on the end of the bed my knees almost hit the dresser. The furniture was chipped as were the picture frames and paint on the bathroom door. The grout in the shower needed repair. The room was clean but the walls are paper thin. We could hear everything! I like the location and the discount on parking but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We were not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Navigator52
Reviews.Content: When reading reviews of the hotel in deciding whether to book or not, I was concerned by a couple of the less favorable reviews. However, we went ahead because of the location and the good rate we received. We were not disappointed! We were fortunate to receive an upgrade to a suite which was spacious with all the amenities as advertised. Large bed with comfortable comforter. The heating/cooling system was very quiet. Windows could be opened. Our room was kept immaculately clean for the two nights we were at the hotel. All staff members were friendly and helpful. We parked out car at the parking garage across the street for $23 per night which is a real bargain in Chicago. We had in and out privileges and being billed to the hotel was a nice convenience. Only one negative; being charged for internet. A new first class restaurant is now on the premises. Great breakfast! This was our first time at the Raffaello. This will be the hotel for us in our future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, outstanding service, very comfortable, exquisite dining experience and a good value.”
Reviews.Author: TrixieChicago
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with a friend at this hotel several times and each time I am more pleased than the last. Other than my own home, this is where I sleep best. This particular visit led us to try the new restaurant on the premises which we named "OH MY GOD" because everything tasted amazing and those were the only words to describe the dining experience. The staff was so attentive. We were treated as if we were guests in their home. The food was beautifully presented and our portions were adequate for lunch. Because we were not rushed, it gave us time to share and savor our courses and look forward to again having the waiter with the generous basket of home-baked rolls and fresh breads stop by our table just one more time. Chef was very helpful and presented our table with appetizer and dessert samplings. It was simply a lovely meal served by exceptionally trained staff and prepared by an outstanding chef in a beautifully appointed, nicely decorated, spotless dining room that had great art provided by a friend of the owners. Lunch was such a memorable experience that we ate breakfast in the dining room the next morning and, of course, we were not disappointed. One may think the prices may be high for breakfast, but let me assure you, that the service, quality, freshness, presentation, and amazing coffee will more than make up for a few dollars you may save somewhere else. Try it. You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “The Raffeallo was a bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jimtoo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Raffeallo. The room itself was a very nice size. We did sleep well. The beds were very comfortable, and I think this may be the quietest hotel in which we've stayed. We were disappointed in two areas. First, the front desk staff was not very helpful. We tried to call multiple times and no one ever answered at the concierge desk, nor was anyone ever seated at the desk. We also tried to call the front desk, and the call went to voicemail. Also, when we were standing in line to check out, two employees were behind the desk. However, the second employee just turned and walked away, while the first employee was trying to help the lady in front of us with reservations for later this year. (We had two families waiting behind us.) The second complaint was the size of the bathrooms. This was our once-a-year getaway, and the bathrooms were very small for the price of the room. (We booked the largest room offered.) The showers were very nice, but there was one small sink and standing-room only. By the way, the restaraunt was closed for remodeling, which was not mentioned on the hotel website. I will say the best thing by far about the Raffeallo was Ferron---the extremely helpful and cheerful bellman!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: finallyko
Reviews.Content: Great location next to John Hancock building and a block away from great shopping. Good sized room, with microwave, large flat screen tv, dvd player. Small but great fitness center. No free wifi but able to print boarding pass for free in business center.

Reviews.Title: “great service, if you like bouitque hotels- otherwise don't bother”
Reviews.Author: pamal100
Reviews.Content: Let me 1st say that the customer service was excellent from the manager to the maids and doormen. We had room problems. Traveling with 2 teenage boys- 6'tall, we called several times to be sure the room had queen beds not doubles. got different stories and finally assured the website was wrong and they were indeed Queens. 2- 6' tall boys sharing a full bed- tight- particularly the night before a race and sleep needed. So, manager changed us to a "Grand Suite" with murphy bed, sofa bed and king bed. What a night! The mattress was so thin on the sofa bed, that my son put it on the floor to sleep, since the rods on the bed were digging into his back. The murphy bed was basically in it's own "alcove" and was a small twin bed. Like sleeping in a box in a box. My son reacted to something inside of it, dragged his mattress to the floor and was wheezing and coughing all night ( not an ashtmatic). He had some type of alergic reaction to something in there. The 1 bathroom was at the foot of our king bed, with full length a frosted glass door panel, the toilet faced our bed and everytime it was used during the night, the light turned on was like a spot light suddently aimed at us in bed, coming through the glass, startling us awake and the person on the toilet- well not the most comfortable situation at the foot of our bed. The bathrooms are like a telephone booth- tiny with tiny designer round sink and shower- no door- a half glass enclosure- but not long enough and the floor would get flooded. The toilet was a bizarre size, to fit in that tiny room. Had to climb over the end of the bed to get into one side. So, the next day, knowing that one son would be staying with his team and not with us, we opted to go back to a double room. There are no Queen beds and 2 rooms was very costly, as was this one. Note that we never share rooms with our kids when traveling, always have 2 bedrooms or 3, so that all can get a good nights sleep,but took a chance this time. The managers were very apologetic, sending us personal notes and one day sent us a bottle of wine with a written apology and will track down who told us they were queen beds. We had given up a long standing reservation elsewhere when we found out they were double beds at an elegant boutique hotel that would have given us 1 night free. Ended up with the same and paying more. This room was very nice,very attractive, spacious but again tiny bathroom- same setup but noraml toilet. At least this was in the entry way away from the beds! Nice rainfall showers and toiletries. Nice well stocked bar ( had pints of alcohol on counter, which we don't drink) and plenty of snack foods, refrigerator. If you don;t like feather pillows you can request synthetic. Elevator very tiny, hold 4 comfortably but no big deal. Restaurant was being renovated, to open soon so no meals there. Nice equipment in gym and a spa which we didn;t use. Terrace on roof top. Beds comfortable enough but not a heavenly bed, for sure. If you like boutique hotels, this is probably a great choice. No lobby to speak of, just a small 2 person check in desk, concierge ( who was of no help at all when asked advice) and a few chairs. Business center on another floor. Excellent location and staff- very accomodating. This is the 2nd time we stayed in a boutique hotel in 25 yrs. of marriage and it will be our last. Just not for us. Would rather stay in a Westin, DoubleTree or even a Marriott with heavenly beds spacious bathrooms and such. No need for the extra attention for us. Oh- we parked the car across the street at the garage for $26/day and left it there for 4 days. Walked everywhere and also took taxis when going far. Great little sandwich/gelato/bakery restaurant around the corner downstairs outside of water tower place. Cheesecake factory is there too. Can sit outside on the steps or inside to eat. I would recommend this hotel only if you like bouitques.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok.....”
Reviews.Author: worldwindow09
Reviews.Content: First, I want to echo other reviewers in saying the location was great. But for the money - I will not stay here again. I travel often and usually stay in 4 - 5 stars properties. The Raffaell is a boutique hotel with very few things to offer other than the location. No restaurant or bar on site. In room coffee maker was tiny. If it weren't for the restaurant across the street there were no dining options - especially breakfast - close to the property . We stayed in a suite which was well decorated. However, the bathroom was extremely small with little room for the placement of toiletries. We killed 2 roaches in the bathroom as well! The only bright spot with the Raffaello was the housekeeping staff and Jason the consir. Other than that........find another property !!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, large room”
Reviews.Author: ricjoa
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right next to the Handcock Observatory and a few meters from the Magnificent Mile, the Raffaello Hotel was a very nice surprise. We have to mention the excellent cafe at the ritz carlton across the street where we had very good dinners and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: PsuMurph
Reviews.Content: They really did a nice job with this hotel, and for the money, a super boutique value. I would not hesitate booking again with my colleagues. Some colleagues did complain about the smaller king rooms. I booked a suite. The rate wasn't much higher than the regular king, but the room is fantastic! One concern was the front desk service. When I arrived, I was expecting a package. But the desk help was unable to locate it, and it had very important work documents. It was later found, but too late. That said, my experience was quite good overall and I plan on booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: Yanwan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Jun 7-9 2009. Booked through Expedia and got a rate of $119 per night for a standard room. But they upgraded me to a suite with a seperate living room and bedroom. Pros: 1) Rooms were new and luxurious with all the amenities (microwave, HDTV, electronic safe, iron, ironing board, rainforest showerhead, hairdryer etc.) 2) The location of the hotel is perfect. Just right beside the John Hancock Observatory on the Magnificent Mile. Other hotels on the Mile would probably be charging a lot higher for their prime location. Budget hotels in the main Chicago district were charging $85 per night so the price and location offered by this hotel was just unbeatable. 3) Valet, doorman and bellman were extremely friendly and helpful. 4) The hotel had a business centre with internet, printing, copy, fax and telephone conferencing service, well- equiped gym and spa. Cons: 1) The Front Desk staff were not friendly and very unprofessional. The manager on duty did not smile the entire time he was helping me make bookings for my transportation and at check out. He even seemed reluctant to help me. At check in, the Front Desk staff were chatting nonstop about unrelated work stuff in front of me and complaining about the hotel being overbooked. Being in this business myself, you definitely do not want your guests to be hearing such stuff. 2) The housekeeping service. They came in only at 430pm to do the AM service when I was just back for a short rest and I did not recieve any turndown service which was supposed to be provided on my two nights. 3) Not too many facilities though. No restaurants, room service, pool etc. 4) They charged for internet! Which hotel in this age still charges for internet? It's $9.95 for 24 hours. Wanted to check my email at the business centre thinking it was complimentary but it was even more outrageous; $5.95 for 15 mins! The only complimentary internet service you could get was for printing out your boarding pass. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel despite the service and facilities. The rooms are superb and comfortable. The best point would definitely for its location and value for money. If you're looking at a comfortable and luxurious stay without paying too much and not needing to use the facilities of a hotel too often, this hotel is definitely the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel.......friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KBcalifornia
Reviews.Content: Girls trip...3 sisters with daughters in their 20's. We had 2 rooms...very spacious and comfy. Bathroom could have been a bit bigger...especially the sink. Great location. Bar and restaurant under renovation...which we knew, but we did miss not having one. In all, great hotel/location for the price. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Upscale, a great value!”
Reviews.Author: journ3eb
Reviews.Content: I needed a nice place to stay for just one nigh, quick in-and-out trip to Chicago, and this was perfect for that. When I checked in they told me they had a suite available for me so they'd upgrade me at no cost. The room was HUGE. It actually consisted of about three rooms with a large sitting room, stocked mini bar with great options, two large flat-screen TVs, a great office/desk area, and the bedroom was large but sectioned off with French doors. The bed had great linens, and I slept perfectly - didn't want to get up in the a.m. The bathroom had nice marble and a huge shower, very well designed and comfortable. There were more than enough towels and closet space for everything. I could have planned a 3-5 day stay in this hotel room. Very upscale look and feel. Well done! Also, the location is fabulous - one block from Water Tower place - the mall of downtown Chicago and one block from the beach and Shedd Aquarium. Convenient cab rides everywhere I needed to go. You can do anything you want to do in Chicago and stay at this hotel - in the heart of it all!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: BrowninLA
Reviews.Content: I made a last-minute reservation at the Raffaello and was pleasantly surprised when I arrived. The hotel does not have its own parking lot, but parking is available directly across the street for $22/day, which is totally reasonable by Chicago standards. My room was pretty large and the bathroom was outstanding, although it did not have a bathtub. The hotel does not have a restaurant, hence no room service. You CAN tuck food in the fridge without setting of the 'fridge alarm" and incurring a charge for moving the hotel's food. Also, the front desk was kind enough to bring me silverware late at night. The good news is there are plenty of restaurants in the area. The hotel's greatest feature is its proximity to Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WHAT I PAID FOR”
Reviews.Author: BillTravellerTexas
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel through Traveleocity. for myself and a colleague for a two night stay in Chicago. Paid around $225 a night. I booked the hotel after reviewing all hotels in downtown Chicago in the same price range and with similar amenities. I wish I had booked one of the other hotels. Upon arrival at this hotel, we were greeted by a hotel desk clerk that was non-verbal to say the least. I had paid in advance for 2 double double rooms. When we got to the rooms neither of the rooms was a double double. They were however the smallest kings in the hotel-(you could tell by the floor maps on the door). So, they had generously given us the worst rooms in the hotel. But we did not complain. It was getting late so we decided to stay in and order something to eat. When we called downstairs we were told they did not have a restaurant and did not have room service. OK, we went out to eat. The next morning my colleague and I were awoken by houskeeping in the hallway steam cleaning the floor--the only way to describe the odor was "sewage". The whole floor stunk. And lastly, tthe business center was unmanned and charged for everything, from looking at email, to any copies. We paid $7 for per 15 minute session and $4 for 8 pages printed. I never write reviews of hotels, but felt that I should for this one. I have stayed in many 4 and 5 star hotels. This hotel, due to the treatment of a pre-paid travelocity customer, and the extreme lack of services and amenities is realistically a 3 star or lower. The hotel website is very attractive, but deceiving. Bill

Reviews.Title: “luxurious and well located”
Reviews.Author: dontworrydontpanic
Reviews.Content: I had a Saturday night stay here. I work for a travel agency so I was given an industry rate and an upgrade to the spacious deluxe suite. It was bigger than my NYC apartment and had a fantastic bed and shower, two flat screen TV's and a fabulous minibar. From the 16th floor I had a nice view of the John Handcock Tower and also Lake Michigan. The location served as a nice stepping off point for shopping along the Magnificent Mile. Only downside was that they did not have an iPod dock in the room and internet was not included in the room rate. Otherwise it was everything I could have wanted! Would definitely return here on a future visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Just Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shopaholic1984
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Mam just returned from a shopping trip in Chicago and stayed in the Raffaello Hotel. Fantastic location, its around the corner from the John Hancock Tower, which is also beside the Water Tower Place(huge shopping centre). It was so central for shopping as its at the top of Michigan Avenue (the Magnificent Mile). There are also little kiosks where you can buy the sight seeing bus tour tickets on Michigan Ave. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the doormen were very quick at getting us taxi's. The room was huge, two big, comfy double beds. The room had a big plasma tv, a microwave and mini-bar/fridge. The mini-bar was expensive but no different then any other hotel?The bathroom was a bit small, but it had a big shower. The room is so bright and very modern. I couldn't fault this hotel in any way. Great hotel for a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room for mom and daughter shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: NVilleGirl
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello is in a great location for spending a few days in Chicago shopping and sightseeing. We self-parked our car at the garage across the street for $23 per day and left it there the entire time. Great shopping and restaurants all within walking distance. The hotel itself is in a fairly quiet location. We had a double room which was pretty spacious for a downtown hotel. The beds were very comfortable and the room and bathroom were very clean. The front desk staff was not very friendly, but the bell captains were always polite and helpful. We booked a 3-night special through the hotel website for $99 per night which I would say was a great value for this convenient, updated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rates, not the best”
Reviews.Author: PauBCN
Reviews.Content: Staff was just correct. The standard room was big compared to other hotels I've been. It's a very well located hotel and if you are lucky, you will have a nice view of the John Hancock building. My room was in front of the elevator and it was kind of noisy. Only one block away is Michigan Avenue with all its shopping and nightlife. I would recommend this hotel if you find a good deal for it. Wi-fi acces was 9.95$ and you may want to have this service for free!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great For Tourists, Not for Couples”
Reviews.Author: gizellemarie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location if you want to be right off Michigan Avenue in the thick of things. My boyfriend and I are Chicago natives who live in the suburbs and wanted a relaxing, romantic evening in the city. I've stayed in some amazing hotels around the world, so I guess when I heard "four star boutique hotel off Michigan Ave." my expectations were high. While there was really nothing wrong with the hotel it did not impress me. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are nicely decorated, the bathrooms are fine, the service was good. It was nice, but it was not Wow. I do have one pretty major gripe with this place: the walls/doors are paper thin. You can hear EVERYTHING. We were sleeping in the morning and heard every door on our floor slam and every person in the hallway talking like they were standing in our room. It kind of made us a little sour on the place. This hotel is good for tourists looking for a good location at a reasonable price, but not if you're looking for any kind of privacy whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel for a girls' weekend in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: THGfromKY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with five of my girlfriends on a Saturday night. The location was perfect for shopping on Michigan Avenue. The rooms were beautiful and spacious; very comfy beds; and provided the perfect atmosphere for relaxing and catching up with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Blocks from Navy Pier”
Reviews.Author: hrzregina
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello was a surprisingly wonderful hotel. In an understated location, but central to all the attractions that I love. Within walking distance of the Navy Pier, Lake Michigan, Michigan Avenue, Shopping, Restaurants and Bookstores. Service in the hotel was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Large and Comfortable Rooms, Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: gsully224
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night at the Raffaello Hotel on March 1. The hotel is a fairly small boutique hotel, and it sure seemed that there were no more than 10 guests staying that night. The check in was very speedy, and the staff met my request by placing me on the top floor, floor 17. I booked the night the day of my trip for $99 through the hotel, and the standard room was great. It was very spacious and newly renovated. Make sure you request a room with a view of the John Hancock, as many of the other rooms overlook a very ugly, old, and worn-out apartment building. For my purposes, this hotel was perfect. It had amazing value, and the close proximity to Michigan Avenue and many restaurants and shops was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - highly recommend. Staff, location, everything - great!!”
Reviews.Author: Inconnu7
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect - directily behind the John Hancock Bldg. The staff is wonderful and go out of the way to be accommodating. My suite was perfect - I couldn't have asked for more. There was a comfortably modern feel. The appliances, the bathroom, etc. were very up-to-date and modern as was the decor. However, it was extremely cozy and comfortable. There is a hidden delight - the 18th Floor has a wonderful roof-top deck. And the price was overwhelmingly reasonable. Only stayed 5 days, wish I could have stayed longer...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Chicago location”
Reviews.Author: wileyc0y0te
Reviews.Content: We loved the Raffaello! Its location is truly in the best place in Chicago possible and we had perfect access to everything we wanted to do in Chicago. The room is perfect, but stay on your toes because everything they offer is expensive, including a disappointing breakfast for which they wanted to charge $10 per person. Don't bother, you're close enough to a great breakfast in a hundred other places outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the price, stay for the nice”
Reviews.Author: PMski
Reviews.Content: Location: About a block away from Michigan Ave, Water Tower Place and right behind the John Hancock tower. If your not from Chicago, this means it is in the heart of the city. It's a safe neighborhood. Parking: Option one - $47/night hotel valet Option two - $22/night self-park right across the street (not truely a self park, because the garage attendant takes your keys and parks the car for you). Lobby: Small, but comfortable. Area for sitting and free coffee. Room: Booked a King room for $99 direct on the hotel site. We stayed on a Saturday night and they upgraded us to a King Suite for no additional charge. The suite was in extremely nice shape and looked very clean. The bed was firm, yet comfortable. All the furniture was contemporary. The amenities at this hotel are limited. It's a place to stay on a budget, but it is a very nice looking hotel inside and out. When you are in Chicago, you don't need a hotel that has everything (just a clean, comfortable place to stay). You're in a city that has it all.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel, fab location, fab staff”
Reviews.Author: exploringaussie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in late December whilst visiting the area. There is absolutely nothing I can fault with my experiences. The door staff are extremely attentive, the price was fantastic and the location is unbeatable. I particularly loved the bathroom as the shower was to die for. I found the decor refreshingly elegant, did not have any issues with the elevators as mentioned in other reviews and would reccomend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Would have LOVED to stay ...but......”
Reviews.Author: pandabaire2
Reviews.Content: Well, my fiance in France wanted to book time at the Rafaello on his trip to see me at the end of this month. After several email attempts with no reply, and a phone call that was switched over from the concierge to the reservation desk and then cut off all together, and a retraction on a request that just a day before the hotel said they would honor - we've decided not to book a room here. I guess they just didn't care to have our business!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: LfromChicago
Reviews.Content: I did not stay there, but I got the help I needed to send a bottle of champaign to friends. Although there is no in house shop today, the concierge ran out and purchased a bottle w/in my price range - by the way - it was below 0 degree wind chill!!!! Then arranged for the bottle to be chilled upon their arrival. great service!

Reviews.Title: “Has Much To Learn About "Service"”
Reviews.Author: abroadinbelgium
Reviews.Content: Ok, so Chicago is an expensive town, and a convention town, so finding affordable and available hotels, while still wanting some comfort and ammenities is not easy. I found the Raffaello online. Great location, I will say that. The rest of the Hotel really lacks in service and style to warrant a 340 dollar per night price tag. There is no restaurant on site, no bar, internet is not free and the doorman will call you cab, if he absolutely has to but as we had 36 degree weather, we had to find one ourself because he was inside getting warm. Service is minimal here. MINIMAL. For the money, stay at budget marriot or best western. At least then you'll have a no frills expectation. I am writing this review FROM the hotel room. Smells like fried food...probably because people have to bring food in from the outside for dinner, unless they go out. My room still hasn't been cleaned. We left at 8:30 this morning so plenty of time. Access to the internet requires a code, fine, but you must enter it in EVERY time you log in as the system does not remember it. Bathrooms are tiny, no space to put anything, one hook for a towel shared with blow dryer. I called the front desk and the concierge this morning. No answer at either. Things happen, no hotel is perfect. But the over all problem of this place is the general sense that this is just a job for the staff. They don't say hello, goodbye, open a door, ask you if you need help, or offer a smile. I'm from LA, I can get that for free. The Raffaello has a lot to learn about service and client relations. A LOT. Starting with remembering that guests come first and are paying to stay there, not the other way around. So, if you lower your expectations, this is a great place. Otherwise, there is a courtyard marriott around the corner. Go there, and save yourself the $$ and the aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dblesq
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago frequently for business, and we discovered the Raffaello back in June. Since then, I've been in Chicago about 8 times and stay there every time. ADVICE: Always book a King room. They're much bigger than the double rooms The staff is friendly, the rooms are spacious and comfortable, and it's a perfect location. It's a 5-10 minute cab ride to our client's offices, right off the Magnificent Mile (though I never have time to go shopping) and a quick cab ride to any restaurant we ever choose to dine in. I'm surprised about the reviewer saying the bellman wasn't around, there's always 1-2 standing there when I get in. I've even been given comp upgrades to a suite, which is FANTASTIC! No, they don't have room service but you can ask the front desk for a couple places that deliver to your room. They are Italian places, but have extensive menus (not just pizza) and the food is pretty good. In the morning, they will deliver breakfast to your room if you put the order on your door the night before. all in all, I'd say stay there. It's a great hotel, great location, and great price. I've never paid more than $240 a night, and for this location and quality of hotel, that's a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Soo nice”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelling5
Reviews.Content: We loved the Rafaello. The decor is fantastic: modern, stylish, elegant and cosy, yet spacious. (No cheesy stuffiness.) Our room was impeccably clean - just how it should be. The little kitchenette was great. Can't wait to go back. We stayed for 4 nights and we actually prolongued our stay in Chicago because we liked the hotel so much. The first 2 nights we stayed in the W downtown which was also fine but we preferred the Rafaello.

Reviews.Title: “If you like NO FRILLS........”
Reviews.Author: CTgirl46
Reviews.Content: From the moment I pulled up in my rental car and the "bellman" looked at me with disdain, until the moment I checked out, my stay at the Raffaello was completely disappointing. The location is great, I'll give it that, but the minute you enter the lobby, it becomes moot. The front desk staff were unwelcoming and not of the caliber nor polish that a hotel demands. I never got so much as smile or a sense that they were happy to have me. I was asked for my credit card and not once did either person look me in the eye. Instead, I received a perfunctory explanation of the coffee bar in the lobby. There was NO bellman to take my bags to my room. I did it myself. The room was spacious, but devoid of charm. The walls still sport their original plaster, albeit covered in an ugly ochre paint job. The bathroom was tiny. A glass shelf installed above the sink meant that every time I bent to wash my face I banged my forehead on the shelf. There is a small closet, so filled with bathrobes, slippers, a safe, an ironing board, an iron, etc., that you cannot hang one item of clothing in it! There is NO room service yet each night a breakfast menu is on each bed. Why??? I could go on. The only saving grace is a young blonde concierge, who's name I didn't get, who helped us both nights of our stay. He was wonderful and some other hotel should go scoop him up immediately. I will never go back to the Raffaello, nor recommend it to anyone I know. The last night of my stay one of the elevators was out of service. It was a Saturday night. I, and a dozen other guests, waited more than 15 minutes to get to our rooms. No one said a word to us or apologized. Disgraceful. For $350 per night this hotel has a long way to go to justify the cost of the stay. It is lacking in every standard set by other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolineCincinnati
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. We visit the Chicago area often and this hotel has it all. It is clean and the beds are great. I love the location, everything is within walking distance. I wish I had known about it sooner. We stayed at the Omni Hotel two years ago and we were very disappointed. The Omni has a great location if you are just visiting the American Girl Place however the American Girl is now moving locations. My recommendation is to stay at the Raffaello were you are centrally located to everything!-Caroline, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “No Frills prices - and they mean it!”
Reviews.Author: blackbora77
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive hotel in downtown Chicago since I was going to be in town on business for a week. I found it in the Raffaello. The location was great, (two blocks from Michigan Ave) and the room was nice. There is no hotel bar or restaurant so be prepared to walk at least down the street to the Westin for food or drink. The room was nice and modern. A spacious bathroom and a plasma TV. However my room had two full size beds, one of which was about a foot away from the closet leaving little room to maneuver to your hanging clothes. The service was decent. Not anything special - but not anything negative either.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dizzyt
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. The location is excellent within walking distance of Magnificent Mile , the beach , navy pier , theatre district etc... The hotel is modern and such a treat if you are used to the hotel chains in the city. The fitness room is clean , good selection of machines and has complimentary fruit. The room was very spacious with microwave , plasma tv , dvd player, refrigerator, shoe shine and a nice (if neck-straining) view of the Hancock building. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and did an excellent job. I noticed on the floor map that some of the rooms seemed smaller than ours, we had two doubles so perhaps keep that in mind. The doorman was also very helpful and the rooftop was a nice place to relax and enjoy the view. This is our new favourite Chicago hotel and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: WolfGang76
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several downtown hotels in Chicago. The Raffaello is in a great place just behind the the John Hancock Building. You can walk to everything. The rooms are great, recently remodeled. For the price, it's our first choice when staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price/Quality ratio for downtown location”
Reviews.Author: toujours1
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello is NOT a typical Magnificant Mile Super-Hotel, all gilt, gaudy, stale and overpriced. What it IS is a clean, modern, stylish hotel with a great location and attractive price for the quality. When I arrived, I realized that I was upgraded to a suite (reserved a standard king) which of course always is a treat! The suite was enormous: a large sitting room area with a kitchenette, couch, and flatscreen tv. The bedroon also had a flatsceen tv, huge king bed, and a large area to store your suitcases. The bathroom was just my style: large glass shower with one of those round, all -fashioned shower heads that sprays you from all over. Also, major plus: bath products from L'Occitane in Verbena scent (love it!) My only complaint was that I asked about restaurant recommendations when the concierge had left for the evening, and the people at the front desk could not tell me one restaurant suggestion. They should be better informed as to this kind of thing. Overall, excellent choice, and perfect downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It”
Reviews.Author: norman08
Reviews.Content: we had a superb time at the Raffaello Hoteo,the concierge ( both Darren and Jared) pushed every button possible for us and were a pleasure to talk to....we made new friends in them. I can't say enopugh about the accomodations, the staff and of course the Concirege---all suoperior

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great location”
Reviews.Author: pelicanbert23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I revisted chicago for our 2nd aniversary. This hotel is great. I loved the 18th floor deck views of the city and the lake. The only complaint of mine is the plumbing. You could hear through the walls everytime someone flushed, showered, or turned on the sink. The beds were every comfortable and service was great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Updated but small and average customer service”
Reviews.Author: rahamill
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world so I know there's no such thing as a perfect hotel but here goes.. When we got there, they checked us in and gave us a room that was still under construction so we went back down to get a new room and they weren't too apologetic. We get to our room and it was very small! It was clean and updated, but small. Europeans would be ok with it, but I needed more space. Then whenever we needed something from the front desk or asked a question, I rarely got a smile and most of the time they acted as if we were bothering them. The door men were nice though! If they want to truly make a name for themselves and go above and beyond, they have to have GREAT service, it was lacking. I would not stay there again, with all of the other great hotels in Chicago that I have stayed at, it doesn't match up at all.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda tiny”
Reviews.Author: Wudja
Reviews.Content: It's okay. Really small bedrooms even in the large king rooms. Bathrooms are ridiculously small and the weird opaque paned door means that your beloved has an uninterrupted view of your goings on in the bath. Location is great. Staff is keen to please if slightly less than qualified. The Concierge doesn't really know anything he didn't read in Where Magazine. For the price, it's a pleasant hotel in a prime location. Don't expect miracles for $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: 5littlem0nkeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this great boutique style hotel. The staff are not overly friendly, but we had booked two king rooms and since travelling with two kids, we wanted adjoining rooms which they don't have, or at least on the same floor. The receptionist was nice enough to put us on the same floor as long as a room with two double beds was actually better for us. This turned out to be to our advantage since the room with two double beds was quite a bit more spacious. Both rooms were nicely decorated, newly renovated (room #711 & 712). A previous reviewer stated that rooms ending in "6" were small but I thought 710 was quite small. We drove to Chicago from Toronto and valet parking is expensive at $45/day.. We found a car park just a block down towards the lake for $24/day. The hotel self-park, around the corner is $28/day. Not enough parking for unloading/loading luggage in front of the hotel. We drove around a couple of times and finally my husband unloaded the car on the side of the hotel's front door (hotel is situated on a corner), and continued on the to the parking garage. Because we were travelling with a young child, we were glad that there was a bar fridge that we could use to refrigerate milk, juice and yogurt. We just emptied it a bit and put everything back in before we checked out. Most hotels don't have fridges at all so this was definitely a plus for us. Elevators are a bit small but sufficient. with the stroller and three adults, that's about all it can hold. But this wouldn't stop me from staying there again. Free coffee in the lobby at all hours. GREAT LOCATION! We didn't move our car from the carpark at all. We paid $29/adult for the Chicago Trolley Co./Double Decker bus which is valid for two days of on/off privileges. It was really very informative and and we always do city tours to learn about the city and to find out where we'd like to revisit. We went to Chinatown, Millennium Park, shopping, restaurants, etc. Navy Pier is walking distance and there are even a couple of full playgrounds within walking distance, one just around the corner and one on the lakeshore that we found on the way back from Navy Pier. We also found out that Oprah Winfrey lives a couple of blocks from here as well in a penthouse apt.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the hotel - HOWEVER”
Reviews.Author: grainnewhale
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my daughter. I can recommend it, but just be careful when checking out. We were billed for a film which we did not view, also we were billed for the mini bar which we did not use. A phone call to Dublin lasting 2mins cost $16, which I thought very steep.

Reviews.Title: “not so happy”
Reviews.Author: bradboss
Reviews.Content: We checked in quickly and ran to catch a Cubs game. We saw room and were surprised how small it was. We just figured that all rooms were that small. The next morning we looked at the map of the floor and realized we were in the smallest room on the floor. I am talking small. When we spoke to the manager he told us we could change rooms but made it sound like the reason we were in that room is because we asked for a full size bed. We decided to stay in room because it is a lot of trouble to move. If your room ends in 06 get it changed. All of these rooms are really small. Other than that the place wasnt bad.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Weekend”
Reviews.Author: svcross
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a weekend vacation for two. The hotel was just updated and quiet. In the meantime, the location was extremely convenient, being one block from Michigan Ave. for shopping and food. The John Hancock Tower, Water Tower Mall and 900 Michigan Ave. were all less than two blocks away. Rooms have flat screen HD televisions and a DVD player and updated bathrooms with great showers. A small continental breakfast and high speed internet is available. The business center allows you to print your ticket reservations for free and we enjoyed the spa services and I found the work out center to be one of the best I have used. We are looking forward to the restaurant that is coming soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: Ask4Him
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! Our family found that the Rafaello was an awesome location for our individual tastes! The doorman "Joe" was very helpful. He assisted in both our arrival and departure. The staff acknowledge our re entry into the hotel both days on our many entries and departures. The bedding and the sleep was the best I have experienced anywhere! Truly a treasure in a location that keeps on giving!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: cdore01
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location for the price of this cute boutique hotel. We stayed for six nights and found the location perfect for our many activities: heading for Starbucks for our morning coffee, walking on the shoreline for the fireworks from Navy Pier, strolling on the Magnificent Mile, getting CTA passes at Waterworks for our six days, catching a bus to the Science and Industry Museum, walking to the river, Grant Park, and the Chicago Art Institute (a very long walk), or heading up to the observation deck and the cocktail lounge of the John Hancock building late at night when no one else is there. Upon checking in, our friends ended up on the 15th floor; we ended up on the sixth. When I looked out our window I saw dirty towels in a huge basket. I immediately went down and requested a room on the same floor as our friends, and never returned to the 6th floor. We were given a two bed room which was fine with us. Our bags were moved immediately, no drama. This is not a view hotel, however, the roof top gives you a glance at the lake and an "in your face" view of the John Hancock building as it is right across the street. The beds were comfy, our room was always clean and ready for us at the end of the day, the business center is open 24 hours (which we needed for Oak Park reservations and the Chicago Architectural Foundation boat tour), and we found the staff cordial, helpful, and doing their jobs well- although we didn't need them except for a question or two. We did not eat here in the morning as we felt we wanted to walk for our breakfast rather than pay $15 a head for a continental breakfast. Starbucks became our morning destination. Cabs were hailed easily, the Chicago Transit Authority Red Line is a few blocks away, and the recommendation by the concierge for dinner at the Rosebud was excellent (albeit expensive but we loved it!) Only downside- a touch of soap residue on the shower corner, bumps in the floor from old wood underneath the rug, and a small glass shelf (too small to hold your sundries) in the bathroom. This was a disabled room, and our friends was too, so I am not sure if all rooms were equipped with grabrails etc... The shower is overhead, so if you are coiffed, it could be a problem for your hair- I washed mine everyday and loved it. This is not a full service hotel. It is all about location, location, location. If you are active (don't mind walking or using a power chair) and want to see the city, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rscrowe
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (Mom, Dad, 17 & 12 year olds) just returned from our four night stay at the Raffaello and couldn't be happier with our accommodations. We got a great rate through Expedia and booked a grand suite, and the room that was assigned to us (405) looked just like the pictures on their website. The room was extremely clean and provided plenty of room for the four of us; our luggage; and our purchases. The only minor flaw, if you could call it that was that on our second day (Sunday), when we returned to our room around 4:00 p.m. -- it still had not been cleaned. The housekeeping crew came by shortly thereafter and I asked them just to haul off the dirty towels and provide clean ones -- which they did. Like all the reviews state, the location is great -- with a great place for breakfast across the street (Mrs. Park's Tavern); and Tempo (another great place for breakfast) just a short walk away. The bellmen were all very nice and friendly and went out of their way in greeting us by name. Additionally, the front desk staff also were very helpful to my 17 year old son by looking up information on the internet for him about various "music" stores and then printing out the information. We will definitely be back and have highly recommended this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location... but could improve”
Reviews.Author: sclev99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rafaello Hotel in Chicago for 3 nights in a Deluxe Suite, just my wife and I for a long weekend. The Good: Modern decor, clean (for the most part), very friendly/helpful bellmen, awesome location - 1 block off Michigan at the John Hancock Center, ability to print out boarding passes for free in their business center, comfortable beds, easy to get a taxi. The OK: Decent breakfast food, seemingly indifferent front desk staff. Deluxe suite looked much larger in the pictures on their site. Sofa in sitting area was uncomfortable. We could hear people next door to us fairly easily. The Bad: Shower floor was disgusting with mildew growing in the corners. Shower glass only goes halfway to the wall, so water splashes all over the bathmat and floor. Thermostat was not working properly (could not adjust the temp), so we were cold most of the time. No free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Adz99
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal through Expedia, absolute steal for Chicago and not available directly so worth checking here. Hotel is lovely, will come hear again for sure. Staff were very very friendly and greeted us each time we came in and out of the hotel, the door men espeically were very chatty and informative. Rooms are gorgeous, very comfy beds, nice kitchenette area with large fridge, mini bar prices not too bad actually. Bathroom is huge complete with L'Ocatianne amenites which were very nice. Shower was superb, really can not fault this hotel. The location is great. In a quiet street but just 2 minutes from the Magnificent Mile and literally next door to John Hanckcok Tower. Also the beach is 2 blocks away. I might ask for at the front of the hotel next time though as there is a lot of extractors / fans at the back which were a bit noisy but i am a sensitive sleeper. The cheesecake factory is below the Hancock Tower, and although a chain, it was a great meal with superb service so if you want something local to the hotel, head there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Raffaello during a recent convention that I attended. I stayed for three nights, Saturday through Tuesday. It is a great small boutique hotel with many nice amenities. There was a flat panel HDTV in my room with a wide selection of cable channels, a fully stocked mini bar and snack tray with reasonable prices for a downtown city hotel. There were great bath amenities including terry robes and slippers and a huge rain drop shower that was very relaxing as well as high end soaps and shampoos. The room was spacious and the location near Michigan Ave and many fine shops and restaurants was convenient. I found that the staff understands how to provide that extra level of service. I arrived early on my check in day and my room was not yet ready so I went on to a business meeting. I had filled in my contact information upon check in and after my meeting I was having a coffee when I received an e-mail on my mobile device that my room was ready. Nice service! There are only two small elevators but both on the weekend and weekdays there was only a small wait for one to come along. There is no restaurant on site but many good restaurants in easy walking distance. There is a small buffet breakfast at the hotel of the typical powered eggs and bacon and muffins and fruit, etc. for $15.95 per day. There is also an Einstein bagel location just a few blocks away for a lighter breakfast and coffee for just a few dollars There is a $9.95 per day charge for Internet access which was my one complaint as many smaller hotels in other cities have done away with these nuisance charges. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: jimmysi
Reviews.Content: i was recently in Chicago on business for a few days and my company placed me at this hotel due to its location The location was perfect, but not much else. Service was lacking, starting at the door; four doormen and no one offered to help me with my bag as i entered the hotel....they all watched me and a co-worker struggle with heavy luggage as we made our way to check in! The room was average, and in need of a renovation; my television did not work and after some effort from the engineer was finally repaired (my co-worker's tv didn't work either); the carpeting was filthy i had to wear my socks the entire stay; there is also no room service- they do have breakfast, but it does not start until 7am (as I was rudely told by the front desk). This seems to be a common complaint from other reviewers. *the second day of my visit it was raining. i did not find an umbrella in my room and asked the 4 doormen standing around outside of the door- they pointed to the front desk. i then went to the front desk, she pointed to the doorman and told me to ask them....no one seemed to want to help me. i eventually extracted two umbrellas from the front desk after much effort and little interest from the attendant in helping us. there must be a real shortage of hotel rooms in Chicago for this place to stay in business the way it's being run. the only thing it has going for it is the location; needless to say, i will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to "Do Chicago" in all aspects!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinBinky
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Raffaello Hotel! A friend had flown in from New Mexico and I drove down from Madison, WI. It was an easy location to get to for both of us, her via the metro from the airport, and me from the interstate. We were both impressed with the location. It enabled us to shop the magnificent mile, go to great restaurants, and "do Chicago" in a big way without ever incurring extra travel expenses via taxis. We were able to walk to just about anything we wanted to see. And as we were two women and out fairly late, we were appreciative of the busy, well lit, safe surroundings. We both agreed we would stay there again for our next Chicago trip and give it the highest ratings. We had previously stayed in several other hotels for our annual trip, but none were as well located to shop and see sights or as easy to reach. We would definitely give this the highest ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: LVAnderson
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for four nights in one of the Grand Suites with our 4 month old baby. Everyone was very accomodating and very nice from the front desk to the concierge. There was no bellmen in sight to help with luggage but because we were traveling light it wasn't a problem. Location can't be beat. Great places to eat (La Appetite located in front of the Hancock Center has great breakfast/sandwhiches)just around the corner and the hotel is just a few blocks from the Red Line (great to take to the Cubs game) and Magnificent Mile. A lot of taxi traffic so we never had a problem catching one to go anywhere else in town. Room itself was roomy but we did miss having a tub. Shower itself was very nice but the toilet was placed oddly in the bathroom but that's being awfully picky. Only other oddity was that the TV controller didn't work properly (would adjust volume when trying to change the channel and then would switch back to normal after a minute). Overall we loved the stay and wouldn't hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: kmfv
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Chicago for a wedding, where we stayed at the Raffaello Hotel. It was truly a wonderful experience. We were traveling with two small children, so I was worried that the staff would be unaccommodating to us and all our gear (double stroller/pack and play/etc.) as the hotel itself is very sleek and posh. It was exactly the opposite, from the doorman to the bellman to the front desk/concierge staff, everyone treated us so wonderfully. They even gave me a rose on Mother's Day and a small gift to our two year-old. The location could not be beat - one block from Michigan Avenue, and literally around the corner from other hotels that were twice the price. Our room was spacious, even luxurious, with many amenities. We opted for a suite given our two children, and there was plenty of room for all of us (and the babysitter during the wedding). I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Chanel519
Reviews.Content: My mom and I recently did a mother-daughter weekend to the Windy City and stayed at the Raffaello. It was a wonderfully charming, unique, classy hotel and we couldn't have been happier with our stay and experience there. The staff was extremely friendly and efficient. We arrived at 10:00 AM and they waved the 4:00 PM check-in time so we could immediately get to our room. The rooms were very, very nice and they had an excellent shower with luxurious bath amenities. We had a stunning view of the John Hancock building from our spacious room. I have a bad back and I'm used to sleeping on a Tempur-Pedic bed, but their beds were extremely comfortable and they used high quality bedding and linens. The concierge was extremely helpful in guiding us with public transportation. We ended up with a cheaper rate booking directly through the hotel's website (cheaper than calling the hotel) using our Triple A membership, but www.travelocity.com, had some excellent rates for this hotel. Definitely worth checking out. Overall, we had a wonderful stay here and would definitely stay here again as well as recommend it to other travelers. The location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly First Rate, Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClassShowroom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just recently returned from a business trip in Chicago. We stayed for four nights in one of the suites at the Raffaello. The hotel is beautiful, our room was large and spacious and the management and staff was impeccable. I am writing this specifically to tell of one incident. I am an apparel wholesaler and I had many samples with me. On the day we departed, three key samples went missing and I was naturally upset since these samples were crucial to my business. I was incredibly upset and showed that to the Assistant Manager as well as George, the General Manager. They treated my situation with the upmost grace and professionalism and offered to reimburse me for the samples or whatever was necessary to make me happy. When I returned to Los Angeles, I found the samples as they were mispacked in my personal belongings. Needless to say, I was horrified and ashamed. I called George to express my sincere and humble apologies and he was nothing but gracious. I have stayed at the finest hotels in the world and I can say with the absolute certainty that the Raffaello is one of them. Thank you to George and your staff for a terrific stay and for being so understanding. Best, Jacqueline Lee Rose, Class Showroom LLC, Los Angeles, California

Reviews.Title: “Great location and intimate setting at boutique hotel The Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: SuburbanMom3
Reviews.Content: Several girlfriends and I were on a weekend trip to Chicago. The Raffaello was a fabulous location. We were accessible to all the great shopping and nightlife of the Magnificent Mile while being in a boutique hotel that was more private and quiet. The service was great and the room size very generous. We had a suite which allowed us to enjoy being in the room and did not force us to use it only for sleeping and getting dressed. We relaxed in the room with a bottle of wine between shopping and our dinner out. It was a great setting to connect with special people in your life while being in the heart of a vibrant city. In addition to enjoying my girl's weekend, I could see myself enjoying the hotel with my husband or on a family trip with our three kids. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and unique style for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: aka_wally95
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and style. Being a smaller facility, you don't feel like your walking forever down the halls to get to your room. Wish there was a restaurant in the building. They also didn't provide a Sunday paper with the shopping ads - it is on the "Mag Mile". Worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: rogmeister0318
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello over the Easter weekend and had a wonderful experience. The great location is obvious, but we also experienced a very helpful and friendly staff. My wife noticed her wedding ring was missing about 5 minutes after we left the hotel. We called the front desk and told them that we thought she had left it on the sink and would be coming back to retrieve it. It turned out that the ring was buried in her cosmetic bag and was not left at the hotel at all. We were gratified (and sheepish), however, that housekeeping in the meantime had started turning the room upside down in an attempt to find our lost property. We thanked them very much for their diligence. We also find the doormen to be friendly and engaging. When we called for our car at the end of the stay, it was ready immediately. I hope all of our hotel stays this year are as enjoyable as this past one.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping taken from our room”
Reviews.Author: honeymoon08Ireland
Reviews.Content: During our recent honeymoon we stayed at the hotel, on front inpression the hotel look fine for the price and location. Then two shopping bags were taken from our room.. When brought it to management's attention, we don't care attitude was sensed. We were treated like liars. Eventually (after four times contacting the hotel during our stay and 3 times after departure) we were told their investigation shows nothing was removed, the CCTV footage only showed empty bages being removed from the room.!!!!! The general manager ended up shouting and hanging up at me. Lock everthing away, if you want to risk it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dougtn
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Raffaello. This is a small, recently refurbished, boutique hotel with a fantastic location and a great rate for the area (next door to the Water Tower Mall, The 900 Shops, Hancock building, and Michigan Ave.). The hotel was clean, well maintained, and our room was spacious and well outfitted. We had extra towels (without asking), and the hotel and housekeeping staff were attentive to our needs. The bathroom was of modern decor in mosaic tile and glass. We also had a great view from our room. On a separate note, while this hotel does offer a nicely equipped gym and spa services (no pool), there is no onsite bar or restaurant. The hotel does offer in-room breakfast service and is near other bars and restaurants. I understand that the hotel is adding on-site dining in the near future. Additionally, there are only two (very small - 4-6 ppl capacity max or 3 ppl + luggage) elevators for the entire hotel, so elevator service could be slow during busy times. We couldn't have been happier with our stay at the Raffaello and would definitely recommend it to our friends and family or couples or singles looking for comfortable, affordable, and well appointed accomodations in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Crooks and Liars”
Reviews.Author: toniafirer
Reviews.Content: I discourage everyone from ever going to this hotel. This is what happened to me: When I arrived I was quite impressed with the rooms, the locations and many other things. The hotel really is very nice - it's the people who work there that I worry about! On my last day there I forgot a considerable amount of money in the pocket of the hotel bathrobe - my fault, very stupid thing to do! I remembered about the money when I was already at the airport. I called the hotel and the housekeeper assured me that she would call the laundry company and make sure they look through the pockets before putting the robes in the wash. I called a few hours later and the receptionist told me that the money had been found and the laundry company employee was going to bring it to the hotel. When I called the next morning, the hotel manager said that only one third of my money was brought back. I called the laundry company and they faxed me a receipt confirming that the hotel manager had received all of the money. When I called the general manager to complain he said to me: "I'm going to be blunt, what you did is a stupid thing and the hotel doesn't take any responsibility for your money because you already checked out". I have of course since hired a lawyer and those crooks will hear from him soon. But I just want to emphasize that apart from taking the money, the managers tried to blame the laundry company for it. To sum up - if you go to the Rafaello you'll find a beautiful hotel with very nice rooms. But there is simply no way of knowing for sure that these liars aren't going to steal from you as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Raffaello was a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: lindacul
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Raffaello for 2 nights. They really have done a nice job withe the renovations. I stayed here 4+ years ago and swore I would never return--it was a dump, and was in dire need of renovations. From the moment we arrived, I was very pleased. The service we received form the doorman and front desk was excellent. Very pleasant and helpful. Had a lovely room (it was quite large, and after looking at the floorplan of the hotel, we did have one of the larger rooms--it was a corner room--1202). Our room had a flat screen TV, large desk, 2 VERY comfy beds. I would say the room was much larger than most I have stayed in in Chicago in this price range. We had a microwave, fridge (honor bar), and coffee maker. There was also a large vanity area. Very small closet. The bathroom was very spacious and nicely appointed. Large walk-in shower with rainfall shower head. Robes available in room. The only complaint I had was the housekeeping service. On our first morning, we left around 10am to shop and have lunch. We returned around 2pm and our room had not yet been attended to. They came while we were there, and had them return when we departed again. We paid $160 on Quikbook and I was very pleased with the quality. And, of course, the location is EXCELLENT! Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BarringtonTraveller
Reviews.Content: Beware of booking at this hotel. They have an incredibly stringent 72 HOUR cancellation notice, no restaurant in the hotel, and a 4pm check-in, all of which I have never run into at any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still waiting”
Reviews.Author: tofupocket
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is quite nice, the room was spacious and well decorated, its in desperate need of a restaurant. My main issue though is that its been over two weeks and theres still a hold on my debit card. I've called three times and each time they say its been refunded and they've faxed the info to my credit company, each time i call my credit company they say they haven't received it. I stay at hotels every couple months and have never had this problem, so i find it hard to believe its my credit company. At this point i'm just going to wait the 90 days for it to come off on its own. Wouldn't stay here again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel with a 'Boutique' feel”
Reviews.Author: Desertfan
Reviews.Content: What an unexpected surprise! Usually stay at the Peninsula Hotel, but due to a booking snafu there, ended up at the Raffaello. Without a doubt, this is my new, FAVORITE hotel in Chicago! Down a quiet street right off the main part of downtown, everything at the Raffaello is absolutely designed to please. Lush, comfortable bedding, well designed room, and a hotel staff that truly knows the meaning of quality service. I was struck particularly by the quiet of the room, and overall, of the hotel. Polite, knowledgable door personnel are unobtrusive, but ever so ready to please. Competent, friendly polished front desk staff make this property a great choice and alternative to the other hotel 'behemoths' of Chicago. The mini-bar was stuffed with pricey items. Had the feeling of an upscale, London hotel. I would endorse the Raffaelo heartily to any visitor in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: gabe05
Reviews.Content: Stayed two weeks at The Raffaello in a one bedroom suite. The suite was large and came with a queen bed in the bed room and a fold down murphy bed in the living room, with two flat lcd TVs. in each room. The decor was modern and clean but the bathrooms were a little on the small side. Room also had a coffee pod machine the coffee was awful and the in room fridge was full of over priced goodies. The staff was extremely help full and polite, the door men Neil, Jordan and Robert were always there to help us with directions and carried my shopping bags up to my room. Had a great relaxing time I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel in Chicago: The Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: maben911
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so conveniently located to the magnificent shoppings along Michigan Ave. Interior decor of the hotel is so luxurious and elegant. Service is excellent. I will defintely stay in Rafaello whenever I have to be in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Maddi-Angel
Reviews.Content: Two of us spent a week here, having gotten a great last minute deal online. We were very impressed with their refurbishment and staff we encountered were polite, helpful and friendly. Having read other reviews on the non-inclusive and pricey breakfast, we decided to eat out (food in room, though abundant was also greatly over-priced, but the same can be said for most hotels). The facilities and location make this hotel a winner though - the little touches like a fruitbowl, earphone covers, hand sanitiser and towels in the gym were great! And if you're going to Chicago to shop, you really couldn't be in a better place - the famous John Hancock skyscraper is about 2doors away! Overall a great experience, would return to the Raffaello any time.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to everything-nice room”
Reviews.Author: thom57
Reviews.Content: Great service, Upscale boutique hotel. My room had a urban kitchen and a living area-almost like my own little condo in the Gold Coast.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: brownie72
Reviews.Content: Great hotel--terrific location 1 block from lakefront and Michigan Ave. Contemporary decor--done very well--in a vintage building. Big room with terrific bed and linens. I loved the decor--new furniture and very clean. The bathroom was great--big walk-in glass shower plus a nice vanity. The room has a small bar/fridge/microwave in the same furniture as the rest of the room. Classy place for a good price. I used miles to buy the room but I think the normal rate is around $200. Go here versus the Drake or Knickerbocker nearby where you pay a fortune and get "lost" in the huge crowds. The hotel's valet parking is expensive at $40--I recommend self-parking within 1 block of the hotel for half the price. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silverlakeguy
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews of the Raffaello Hotel we decided to take a chance and book a room for a 4 day stay. We found the Raffaello to be a wonderful choice. The location really can't be beat. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. It was the dead of winter and very snowy and cold outside. The rooms were heated nicely and thanks to the location we never had far to walk. The only thing we wished the Raffaello had was a restaurant and a bar. You will have to leave the hotel for that. Oh and the elevators are very tiny. Well worth the price. We will definitely return to the Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Continental Breakfast is misleading”
Reviews.Author: emilysmarathonmom
Reviews.Content: The Hotels.com description of this property indictated that there would be continental breakfast and although not specifically stated that it was included it did not say for a fee as the internet service did. When you see continental breakfast available in a description and it lists only a few items you assume that it is included NOT $15/pp. Definately NOT worth $15/pp. Just be warned. Hotels.com should fix their description as I was not the only customer that got the wrong impression.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Cozy and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: advnterur
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Raffaello hotel in Chicago for a work related convention and based on the quality of my stay, am compelled to post my sincere compliments. I stayed for 3 nights in one of the suites on the 8th floor and was thoroughly impressed by the roomâ€™s layout and the sleek dÃ©cor. My wife accompanied me on this trip and she loved not only the convenience of the hotelâ€™s location to the shopping on Michigan Ave, but also the quality of the room.
