She found the bed so comfortable that she was conflicted on whether to leave to shop or just stay in, shopping won out eventually but she did mention that it was a close decision! My trip involved an evening dinner function and the convenience of the separate vanity from the bathroom was critical in letting both of us prepare unrushed for the event. Given the roomâ€™s sleek dÃ©cor we would have no reservations to invite friends up for an evening nightcap. Although we did not have an opportunity to do this I was tempted so that I could show off my room! My colleagues were all staying at the mega-hotel that was hosting the work-related convention and were rather envious given my description of the Raffaello. My wife and I loved it and look forward to staying at the Rafaello again, perhaps for a casual weekend getaway to Chicago. My sincere compliments to the Rafaello staff who were very accommodating. I look forward to visiting Chicago again and to staying at the Raffaello when I do.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Carl10022
Reviews.Content: One night at the Raffaello, quick business trip. Room was fully renovated, bed very comfortable, bathroom fixtures very modern. As this was a quick trip I didn't have much time to check out the hotel - the lobby seemed very small though. Excellent location off Michigan Avenue down the street from the Four Seasons where my meetings were. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in Love with Raffaello!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey0534
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Raffaello through a recommendation from one of my friends who travels on business. It seems I came during a convention time, and even though the rate was high it was well worth it. From the moment I checked in the staff was great, especially the bellman and night front desk staff. The lobby is beautiful, reminds me of a small european hotel i stayed at when backpacking through Europe. The rooms were a nice size and the decor is very nice. I loved the showers and beds. It was the best sleep I have had in a while. The location was great for shopping and restaurants. Signature Room is right next door for drinks and the best view in the city. I would definitely recommend this to busniess and leisure travelers alike!!

Reviews.Title: “Urban Chic - Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Skywren520
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on hotwire.com and got a great deal. However, when we checked in-the hotel had no record of our reservation. Obviously it was no fault of their own but they were very accomodating and made sure that the issue was resolved without incident. The room was beautiful, clean and updated-Very chic and urban. The mini bar was amazing (even though I didn't splurge) it was completely stocked with a wide variety of tempting snacks and drinks. The location is superb! It is conveniently located between the John Hancock building and the lakeshore, right on the Gold Coast. I highly recommend this hotel and for the steal we got, I would try hotwire again. It was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Hmm..Location great, hotel could do better”
Reviews.Author: Doralee_Rhodes
Reviews.Content: As location goes, you can't beat this hotel for Magnificent Mile shopping and John Hancock Tower. Unfortunately we arrived to a cloud of dust at the front door as the construction is still ongoing. On the plus side, we got access to the hotel earlier than normal which was great but on arrival to the large suite (we paid $490 through the hotel's own website) there was a mop in the bedroom, no toilet paper and empty cigarette packet and crisps on the floor in the living area-maybe we chased the cleaner out before they'd finished?! Decor was nice and new, the bed comfy but no free internet? Lesson learnt- check convention timetables before travelling to Chicago last minute to avoid paying over the odds for hotels!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, stylish and good value”
Reviews.Author: aquadotto
Reviews.Content: This excellent hotel deserves a better ranking, and will likely get one now that the renovations are complete, or nearly so. We selected it based on price and location but were very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the place. We booked just a week ahead of time through Expedia (I think) and paid about $190 per night, all in. Our room (#1609 which was a suite) had clearly been renovated recently and to a very high standard. Great bed, really good linens, two LCD flat panel TV's, lots of nice touches including granite countertops and a stainless steel microwave (that we actually used to heat up some Chicago deep dish), iron and ironing board, and a stylish bathroom (shower only). The room was quiet and clean. We neither saw nor heard any evidence of the renovations, except that everything appeared new. I see some of the postings mention not-so-good service but our service was great. The "front desk" is just that, a simple two-person podium, a refreshing change from those long monolithic reception counters found in most hotels. I don't hesitate to recommend the place. Also recommend Bistro Campagne out in Lincoln Square (about 25 mins by cab).

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable reservations”
Reviews.Author: ccc74
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite at this hotel a couple months in advance for our wedding night. We asked that the reservation be flagged as our wedding night in hopes that we wouldn't have any hiccups. Had a confirmation number and everything so didn't anticipate any problems. When we got there around midnight (in our wedding clothes), the front desk told us our room was no longer available (with no explanation). Also told us that the only room they had left was a double/double ( no king beds available). We almost left and went back to our apartment, but were too tired and since they agreed to comp the room we just stayed at the hotel. The double beds are so small and uncomfortable that we ended up sleeping in separate beds. Needless to say, we were disappointed but did get a laugh out of the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: kinderfitz
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on our stay at the Raffaelo on a Sunday night. We had two rooms on the 16th floor that had a view of the John Hancock building. One of the rooms was a great corner room with windows on two sides. The room was beautiful and clean. The room was large and the bed was a plus - very comfortable and great sheets. Our room was very cool but we were able to turn down the air conditioner. I stayed very comfortable under the down comforter on the bed. We walked across the street to a restaurant named Mrs. Park's and had a great breakfast. The location was great and we had goodservice from all the staff. The front desk people were efficient, the concierge made a dinner reservation for us and the doorman was lots of fun to be around. Even the maids made conversation with us when we saw them in the hallways. We got GREAT value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price... Benefits From it's Location”
Reviews.Author: targetguy
Reviews.Content: this is just a average hotel... there is noting spectacular about it, to command the price they charge.... i had a gift certificate from teavelocity... and it was valid for 2 nights any room, so i picked the most expensive room.. this hotel and stayed in their grand suite, i was a little disappointed to say the least the advantages of this hotel is ? ________________________________________________ 2 flat screen tv's and dvd player (bring your own movies) the neighborhood is the best in chicago, it's directly across the street from water tower place and a block from john hancock bldg the disadvantages are? _____________________________ no resturant no swimming pool charges $ 40 a day 4 parking 2 small elevators, that even the bellboys have to use, so if u want to avoid this, stay on a lower level floor and take the stairs the shower head is not adjustable. so if u are over 6 ft be ready to squat down the bed was very very hard and uncomfortable the view i had on the 24th floor was a view of a back alley with garbage dumptsters there is no resturant on site charges for computer access, and its not even in your room, u have to go on another floor to use their computers charges $ 10 bucks for a continental breakfast of coffee and muffins ( the previous hotel before the name change offered the same thing 4 free) has a mini bar fridge but it is loaded with $ 3.00 candy bars and $ 4.00 small 8 oz sodas.... when a hotel is charging $ 350.00 a night for their best room in this area you expect something for the money..... i stayed here because it was free, but this hotel got paid regardless( it just was not from me ) this hotel benefits from its location..... and i can see why they were the only hotel in the area with rooms during my stay... even though the Lalalpalooza music festival was going on a 1/2 mile away at grant park---

Reviews.Title: “Classic boutique”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED. Tony boutique hotel just behind John Hancock building, prime location. Booked via Hotwire. Checkin uneventful. 12th floor room, quiet, but very small, #xx06, this is not a room to get stuck in with 2 people for an afternoon. Room sizes due vary, assume I got small one because of the Hotwire. Very nice amentities, Bedding extremely comfortable and nice decor. Bathroom hi-tech, well illuminated, but quite small again, Classic boutique and a good overall experience. Didnt eat in hotel, numerous nearby choices for all hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Great location, Poor service”
Reviews.Author: evvmom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of July. Overall, the room was great and the location was better, but the service was indifferent at best. Towels were missing from our room one day and coffee the next. Phone calls to the front desk did correct these problems. The front desk personnel were pleasant, but not terribly helpful. We really liked the evening doormen. However, the morning we checked out, no one offered to help us load our luggage into our car. I was rather surprised. Also, the lack of a restaurant is unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: sampsongraham
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to take a moment to let you know how much your doorman, Robert, helped us out. My friends and I visited Chicago last weekend to celebrate a birthday. As soon as we checked into your hotel, Robert was at our service. It was our first visit to the city and he was more than happy to assist us with directions and recommendations all weekend. One member of our party was disabled and Robert went above and beyond to make sure we had accessible transportation whenever we needed it. He is an excellent member of the service industry and made our trip enjoyable and memorable. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Trifecta of Location, Price and Room Trumps Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Pilar78
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Raffaello Hotel in Chicago. I booked through Hotwire over a month in advance, and got a really good deal (under 150/night) at the Raffaello. After having read some of the reviews here, though, I was a bit nervous about staying at this hotel. We arrived around 11 am, figuring we could at least check our bags. Check in is at 4 pm, and we were initially told to return then - but the concierge told us we could come back at 2 and a room would probably be ready. This was fine - we did some sightseeing and then returned. The room was not yet ready; however the bellman had already brought out our bags and so they had to be rechecked. No problem so far. We came back at 4 and check in itself went smoothly - however they had lost our bags. After some frantic searching in different employees' offices, they were finally located. It's this kind of disinterested service ethos that really brings the Raffaello down - it's the level of service one would expect from a college town Days Inn. The employees at the Raffaello are affable enough, but they really don't want to concern themselves with any problems or questions guests may have - they seem to universally want guests to just go away and leave them alone. Lousy service aside, the room itself was as pictured - quite lovely actually. Bed was great - tv was nice - all were up to snuff. Location can't be beat for the price - right off Michigan Ave. behind the Hancock building. I would probably still stay here again - I just wouldn't check my bags with them. If they find a way to work out the service kinks this could be quite a nice hotel. FYI - they charge 40 bucks a day for valet parking - and all they do is drive your car to the deck across the street. You can self park there for $23 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Room looked exactly like the one on the website!”
Reviews.Author: Ginger_Rachel
Reviews.Content: My family and I stopped at the Raffaello for two nights in mid July. Overall the rooms costs approx. 100 pounds per night. for a double. Considering the price of British hotels, we thought that the hotel was extremely good value for money. I think that for the first time ever, I can say that the room was stayed in look almost exactly the same as the ones shown on the website. Normally this never happens. We all thought our rooms were fantastic. The decor was beautiful and luxurious ... and most of all spacious (we were in room 812 ... my brother was in an even bigger one). Maybe we were just lucky, I'm not sure. The decor and furniture was very modern and tasteful. I thought the shower was fantastic, but at 5 7", I only just fit underneath it. My boyfriend struggled, and we were unaware that it was adjustable (no instructions). The location is great, just a block away from the John Hancock building and the Magnificent Mile (shoppers beware - you will spend a fortune). Plus only a couple of blocks from the lake. We didn't really have any problems with the staff, but then we didn't have much cause to use them. However, with only a small check-in desk and lobby, I imagine that it could get crowded and busy at times. They did try and charge us drinks from the minibar which we hadn't drunk, but it was cleared up quickly. Breakfast was a bit of a disappointment. I asked at the desk the night we checked in where they could recommend to go, and they pointed to the place across the street under the Hilton. It was only the desk morning after making plans to eat there that we discovered they offered a continental breakfast buffet. I thought that it was slightly odd that the staff didn't mention it. We breakfasted at the hotel the day after - it was ok but not worth $10. Other than this, our stay was very pleasant indeed. I would stop here again and also recommend friends to stop here too.

HotelInfo.Name: Raffaello Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 201 East Delaware Place, Chicago, IL 60611
